Reviews.Content: I ordered this camcorder after reading reviews.  I absolutely love it!  It is easy to use and takes very good videos.  I carry it everywhere!

Reviews.Title: Review for those people who want to film sports
Reviews.Author: kimark
Reviews.Content: I recently bought the sony bloggie because i was looking for something that was durable and in HD. The sony bloggie does just that, this video camera shoots in great HD and is durable. I am a sports lover and wanted a camera that would be good for shooting sports. In the camera market, some cameras are better for sports than others, for example if a camera blurs with side to side motion it is not a good option for someone who will be filming on the sideline trying to get all the action from side to side. The Camera is great once it is in focus, sometimes it takes a second to auto focus but it has never been a big deal for me. The touch interface is user-friendly and easy to work with. The 720-60fps is a good feature for good quality slow motion play-back. I love this camera because it is durable and can handle quick movement and shoots good quality video. If there is loud sound it doesn't sound very good on this camera but for a sports lover like me I hardly ever use the original sound anyways, I got the case and a screen protector for it as well, i have dropped the camera a few times because I was running with it jumping off things ext. but this thing didn't even get a scratch. It is a great affordable durable camera that will keep on filming. I highly recommend this product to anyone looking to start filming.

Reviews.Title: Purchase of Sony Bloggie
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my Husband as an easy means to get video footage on our granddaughter without having to bring out the rather large and difficult to set up version from the past.  We love it and carry with us everytime we have a family event. The only draw back that we see is the ability to download and share with our family. In any case we do have memories and love the product.

Reviews.Title: Can't believe the quality for the price!!!
Reviews.Author: Carla
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my son, who makes and edits his own videos for YouTube.  He wanted something very easy to use without too many settings.  This was perfect for him.It has three shooting definitions, which will determine the length of time you can shoot video:720p (lower quality)- 4 hours720p (higher quality)- 3 hours1080p (highest quality)- 2 hoursYou can also take 12.8 megapixel still photos using a camera setting or by pressing a button WHILE YOU ARE SHOOTING VIDEO!There is also up to a 4x zoom that can be moved in and out while you are shooting.  Plus it's HD and can easily be connected directly to a computer with the USB connecter that snaps out or by using a HDMI mini cable (not included).Best yet - you don't need to purchase a memory card as this has 8GB of memory built right in!Like most cameras, the video gets a little bit grainy when in full-zoom mode, but at all other times is excellent quality.  The touch controls are self-explanatory and easy to use.  The camera has a quick start and fits easily into a pocket or case.  LOVE it and my son has had excellent success with it - either by carrying it around to shoot or by mounting it on a tripod.I do, however, recommend a good quality screen protector as the touch screen, with a lot of use, may tend to get scratched.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Kikkboxer310
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for anyone who likes to takes pictures or most, record videos. Instead of bringing my DSLR i can bring my bloggie and record in 1080 just as well, although the pictures aren't as great as the DSLR, it's more than good enough. I like the size of it kuz you can put it in your pocket or in a pouch on your waist, and it feels lighter than a phone(some phones). But other than that, the video quality is perfect. Great camera and very durable, also battery last a long time even with turning it off and on to record.

Reviews.Title: sony cam
Reviews.Author: thearchitect
Reviews.Content: great little cam, takes wonderful video and some great stills, very very happy with this, only had this for one week but feels well made

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch Camera, 4-Hour (Black)
Reviews.Author: Lindsey
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera! I love this camera and Amazon once again proved themselves with the great price and fast/reliable delivery. This camera looks great and has a very elegant design. The big touch screen is beautiful and functions very smooth. The camera takes excellent pictures and video including very nice quality high definition. I use a 50 inch LCD TV to view the video and even with that size screen the HD is smooth and brilliant. I love how the camera has built in USB which makes connecting it to a computer easy and fast. You can use the extension cable but it even if you don't have anything other than the camera you can connect it to any computer. Overall awesome camera for the price and ordering it on Amazon makes the experience fast and easy!

Reviews.Title: Great for vlogging
Reviews.Author: Timothy
Reviews.Content: For youtube volggers, this is perfect, makes for very easy recording all in a small and compact enclosure. I am very happy with this recorder. Very pleased

Reviews.Title: Is much better than I imagine
Reviews.Author: Vanessa Campos
Reviews.Content: The Sony Bloggie is very easy to use and more easier to download to pc. Is much better than I imagine.

Reviews.Title: For Pros, or not for Pros?
Reviews.Author: knightace
Reviews.Content: I spent a good deal of time reading over all reviews here, including members from the "VINE" program, before purchasing this product. As such I felt I was quite ready to purchase this item and already understood exactly what I was purchasing. When the product arrived, I tested it out and found that I was not surprised in the least by its performance. It was exactly what I was expecting.The camera takes excellent quality shots, and very nice videos (note: at 720 x 60 video quality). The sound quality that it records with was actually better than I had expected, I have no complaints about that.One noticeable problem that I was already aware of, is to try to be as still as possible taking the shots or they blur very easily - both pictures and video. It doesn't take much movement to ruin a picture, and videos do have to continuously "refocus" when moved (this is less noticeable at 720 x 60, more frames/faster refocus). The camera has a 1080p video feature, but I would not suggest using it - as I had already been warned to. The 1080 is at 30 frames, unless the camera is sitting on a tripod it'll be constantly refocusing when moved. Oh and; don't even think about taking pictures/video with this camera held vertically...it screws them up. Keep it horizontal.Overall it's perfect for what it does. I'm not an expert photographer/etc, I just wanted a simple, reliable product that was easy and fast to use and supplied me with both photos and videos that were both of good quality. This does just that. If you are a professional photographer I would suggest to get something else; this will probably irritate you greatly.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, though with a few limitations.
Reviews.Author: Jerry Saperstein
Reviews.Content: The Bloggie TS-20 is very simple to use. Turn on the power: press the movie switch. Take your video. Hit the play button on the touchscreen to play it back. You can take stills while taking the video. The view screen is a very generous and bright 3 inches.All settings are made from the touchscreen, which is fairly responsive. The settings icons are big enough for a fumble fingers (like I occasionally am) to use.There are three photo size settings: 2 MB and 8MB for 16:9 ratio photos and a 12 MB 4:3 setting. No flash, so there is a lot of noise in the images once you leave bright daylight.There are also thee settings for video 720 and 1080 at 30p and 720 at 60p. Video quality is pretty good. It doesn't match higher end camcorders, but footage from brightly lit scenes is quite good. The lower the light level, the more noise you'll have. I tried some poorly lit indoor footage and despite the golf-ball sized noise, it was viewable.Focus is on the slow side. There is a 4X digital zoom which doesn't degrade the image too much.The USB connector pops out the end of the camera and Sony is kind enough to provide a short USB extension. There is a full size HDMI port, though you need to provide your own cable. I didn't try outputting to HDMI. Since the software provided with this kind of camera is, at best, mediocre, I didn't even try it. The file format is MP4 and opens nicely in just about contemporary video editing program.The camera is very compact, about 2 x 4 inches. The surfaces are all very slick which makes it difficult to hold. You will definitely want to use the included wrist strap. There are a couple of drawbacks, which I consider to be major, but not showstoppers. First, the camera must be used in the landscape or horizontal position. I'd rather have the option of a smaller image in the viewfinder, so I could hold the camera in a vertical position. Us it in the vertical position and the video is actually truncated! The tripod socket is on the bottom of the unit when viewed vertically. This means you must have a pan head capable of rotating 45 degrees. This simply adds to the problem of keeping your perspective correct.Overall, as such vidcams go, this one is very nice. Simple to use. Huge viewfinder. Excellent image in bright lighting and more digital zoom than others. Sound is passable. And output is industry standard MP4. Not a bad choice at all to carry with you.Jerry

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, poor software
Reviews.Author: Convectuoso
Reviews.Content: I bought a Bloggie camera last year. I was attracted by the touchscreen, the internal flash memory and USB arm. I have to admit that I've taken really nice pictures with it and recorded some cool videos, but only on daytime, since Bloggie does not feature any flash or built-in system to get clear images on dark places. The other disappointing issue is the featured Bloggie Software, meant to be totally user-friendly to share pictures but, at least in my case, the software has never been able to create any preview or sample of my pictures, bcoming totally useless. My only choice has been to transfer my pictures using Windows Explorer. A real shame. I contacted Sony's Support Center, but they weren't able to solve my issue.Apart from that, the picture quality is realy good, and is a fun camera for amateur photographers. I recommend it to anyone who doersn't care about the flash and software issues.

Reviews.Title: The Sony MHS-TS20 Bloggie HD camera
Reviews.Author: Don
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at Frys after playing around with it in the store. After I got it home I mounted it on my radio controlled airplane for some airborne video. I watched the video on the Bloggie and was quite impressed by the video quality. I took it home and hooked it up to my ROKU box to watch the video on my tv. I was shocked and really disappointed by what I saw.While the video quality was excellent, my excitement was quickly removed when I saw that the video picture was only several inches wide. It did not fill the screen as I had hoped and assumed it would. I bought an HDMI cable for it in hopes that might help. No luck.I posted it on Youtube for those that want to see what I'm talking about. The link is, I guess they block links. You can do a search for "Easy Star Mission Bay".Why would anyone design something like this? It's useless in that (vertical) mode. I figured maybe I was doing something wrong. I went to the web and quickly found that this is a common complaint with this camera.I then emailed Sony support asking if this was a flaw and perhaps I was overlooking something. Here is their response,Thank you for contacting Sony Support.I'm sorry to inform you that the image cannot be recorded in landscape mode while the Bloggie Camera is held in vertical orientation. However, please transfer the images to Computer and use any third party Software to change the images from portrait mode to landscape mode.Thank you for your time.The Sony Email Response TeamC2X7AnaNeedless to say I'm not happy about the product. How hard would it be to rewrite the code to allow a selection of portrait or landscape modes?Everything else on it works well. Although, as others have stated, in low light or room lighting, the stills are grainy and not real impressive. That doesn't bother me much since my intended use is outdoors.Since there is a very small light scratch on the display I don't think Frys will take it back. Otherwise I would return it.I would not recommend this camera.I returned it today!!

Reviews.Title: Great for parents
Reviews.Author: H. Erickson-Sander "Heather"
Reviews.Content: With our second daughter about to arrive, we decided to purchase a video camera to capture both the first moments in the hospital and also those special moments with our two girls at home. Overall I'm very happy we decided on the Bloggie.My favorite qualities of the Bloggie are:- very easy to use and set up- simple touch screen, never even read through a manual before use- extremely compact and can come anywhere in my purse, a huge change from the video cameras from my youth!- easily hooks up to my TV so I can instantly share videos with my family or watch them immediately myself- all you ever need to do to charge or load videos onto the computer is pop out the USB plugWhat I wish they would improve upon is the auto-focusing feature does not always work well or is often delayed. This happens sometimes even in well lit rooms (like the very brightly lit room during my c-section!) I also wish they had positioned the microphone differently, as the way I catch myself holding the camera sometimes my finger positions over the mic and the sound is then muffled. But that's just something I've become aware of as I use it.We very nearly decided on the Flip camera instead of the Bloggie, but in the end we were sold on the longer recording time.

Reviews.Title: What Sony Didn't Tell You
Reviews.Author: Christopher Robert Mohr
Reviews.Content: I just purchased a Sony Touch Bloggie MHS-TS20 camcorder.The camcorder has a nice sleek look and the packaging is superb.  It comes in a good quality felt lined box and looks better than the usual vacuum packed item.I have not yet been able to truly evaluate the picture quality of this device although from what testing I have done it looks very adequate for the price.I am rushing to do this review because I want to alert anyone considering the purchase of this camcorder to the fact that when you are out shooting beautiful things, you will be able to see the video you have captured, but you will not be able to hear the audio that you hope you have captured.  Even with the playback volume turned all the way up, the sound playback is just slightly audible if you really strain to hear it.  I contacted Sony and was told to transfer my video to my computer and then play it back.  The sound should be normal.Unfortunately I cannot do this because right now I am having computer problems and my computer sound is completely dead.  I have ordered a mini HDMI  adapter so that I may play my video through my HDTV.  However, I will not receive that until next week sometime.But, why do they have sound circuits and a volume control in the Bloggie if they will not function normally on play back?  I sent Sony another email and this is part of what they said: "Please note that, the Camcorder records the sound at a standard level for consumer models, ensuring linearity. Therefore, the recorded sound is lower than non-consumer devices. As the noise level is also lower, there is no problem with signal-to-noise ratio of the sound. Please turn up the volume of both the Camcorder and the other device, to increase the sound during movie play back."Gooble-dee-gook.  A fancy way of saying, "So you won't know if your sound is any good until you GET HOME from your once-in-a-lifetime outing. Life is tough all over fella!"  Had they said that it would have been better than not saying anything until after you buy the product.The camcorder has quality and is certainly worth the price.  Too bad Sony had to skimp on design.  They could have at least included a headphone output which would have improved the audio tremendously. But lying by ommission, puts a very bad taste in the mouth of anyone who appreciates knowing all the facts BEFORE they buy a product.This is a revision of my above review.When played back through another device the sound is adequate except video and audio can play back all chopped up.  However, if you play that video again it can show normally.  The bottom line seems to be that you have play around with it to get good results.  You will learn by doing.  The complaints some reviewers had about this product were based on ignorance and lack of common sense plus the inability to have a little patience while learning to use it.My contribution to ignorance was that I was completely unaware that I could not expect to play back sound in the field and felt that it might be a defect in the unit.  But Sony should have seen to it that their advertising removed the chance of someone having that ignorance.All in all, you could not get a better mini camcorder for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good enough for $159
Reviews.Author: Luis Garcia
Reviews.Content: Pros: Awsome video quality, fits in my back pocket, beautiful design, bargain priced, and its a SONY!Cons: Touchscreen should be a tad bit more responsive, no flash when taking pictures in low light ambient, very grainy photo quality at night, only 30 min recording at a time, no 1080p @ 60fps setting (only 30fps).Overall I am satisfied enough, yes I do recommend it as an ultra portable and inexpensive gift! :)

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Hardware, don't both with the software
Reviews.Author: Jason Goldberg "Retailgeek"
Reviews.Content: I just picked up a MHS-TS20 to replace a first generation Flip Mino HD.  In general I'm satisfied with the purchase.Pros:Great formfactor/sizeBuild Quality - it does feels like a sturdy well-made metal product (vs. the flimsy plastic of my old Flip)Speed - it starts up quickly and can have me recording in about 3 seconds.  The menus are reasonably responsive.Video Quality - 1080p looks pretty darn good, the tiny lens and sensor aren't great in low light, but nothing in this category is.Image Stabilization - while not as good as a real camcorder, it's a big improvement over no image stabilizations.Stills - the stills are decent and it can even capture stills while recording video.Cons:Audio - no provision for external mic, and the internal mic has tons of handling and wind noise.  I didn't expect decent audio out of this device, and pretty much got what I expected.Focus - I was satisfied with the fixed focus on my old Flip.  The Sony has auto-focus which is an improvement in some cases, but can also be a negative when the camera starts hunting for focus and gives you no control.  Being able to use the touchscreen to define what to focus on, or being able to lock the focus on infinity would be a big improvement.Software - Don't plan on using it.  You can't specify where on your PC it stores your video/still files.  You can't add new sharing services (SmugMug, Vimeo, etc...).  It has no editing beyond basic trimming.  It doesn't let you manage what stays on/comes off the camera, etc...  You'll be happier if you just assume it doesn't come with any software.Misc - It has some silly misses, such as no way to tell what firmware version you are using, how long a video clip is, etc...Orientation - I wish the sensor/lens could rotate 90 degrees.  If you want normal landscape format video, you must hold the camera in landscape which is slightly less ergonomic than holding it in portrait.  With the Flip, you can shoot landscape video while holding the device in portrait, which is better for one handed operation.Bottom Line:  If you need a small/simple device to capture pretty high quality ad-hoc video clips, this will do a good job. If you're expecting a full-featured video camera replacement you'll probably be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Better than you might think
Reviews.Author: M. Onsgard
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for a very specific purpose.  We wanted a camera that we could use to film parkour, free running, and skateboarding with so portability was key.  What we ended up with was a camera that not only performed for those purposes more than adequately but was found to be a great camera all around.Pros:The camera is very light yet felt very solid. The 12.8MP still image sensor performs very well and even catches slight movement VERY clear.  The video recordings are taken in mp4 (ipod) format which all of my video editing software accepts fine.  We needed to update Windows Movie Maker to get it to work with that though. Once set up, you can mark pictures and videos to be uploaded and/or emailed, then when you plug the camera in to your computer it does it for you.  The USB is attached to the camera itself so there is nothing extra to carry.  If you need a quick charge, borrow a USB port from a comp and get charging.  The camera also comes with a USB dongle for those ports that are not in the most convenient spots.  The screen on this looks fantastic.  8GBs of storage is plenty for me.  If I have 4 hours of video on it and have not uploaded then I am doing something wrong.  The power up time is minimal.  I havent timed it but I would say its about 2 seconds from power button push to ready to shoot.Cons:The touch screen is really sensitive.  Now it is not so sensitive that it causes a great amount of frustration, but in my opinion it is a little too sensitive.  An option would be appreciated in which the screen sensitivity could be adjusted.  That might be asking a lot, I dont know but it is just how I feel.  The same could be said about the accelerometer (the thing that makes the screen adjust when you turn the camera).  Sometimes I feel like I barely tilted the camera and the screen will adjust on me.  Now, its not a big deal because it easily comes back.  They may have made it like this to be responsive while shooting.  The manner in which I take pictures and video, that amount of sensitivity is not necessary.  The USB dongle that comes with the Bloggie is a little short.  I am not sure if it will actually make anything better if plugged in to a front USB port on a full size tower PC. Unfortunately in retail, its not the thought that counts.Summary:If portability is the name of the game then this camera provides a lot of options at a decent price.  Of course there are better cameras on the market that will do one thing much better than this camera but the Bloggie does all sorts of things really well. At the time of this review Amazon was selling it at 155 dollars, Prime eligible and worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Compared to an Iphone 4
Reviews.Author: GX
Reviews.Content: Compared to an iPhone 4In back to back tests between the Bloggie Touch and an iPhone 4 (using the standard Apple camera app) the two were more similar than not and definitely in the same league. However in my view the iPhone had better color, white balance, gps tagging and a better user interface -  (although it is at a lower resolution on the iPhone). Worth having two devices? I think the main reason would be something like an overseas adventure where you don't plan on bringing a laptop and already have your iPhone stuffed to the gills. In either case you will get `good' video at a great $ value. If you don't have an iPhone this is a worthy contender.If you want `great' video quality you need to move away from small sensor devices into pro-consumer grade digital camera and micro four third systems. If there is one key point to convey; the video resolution only matters so much... with complex scenes the bitrate of the stored video will matter more and a 1280 x 720 video with a compressed 30 Mbps output will outshine a low bitrate 1080i.

Reviews.Title: Bloggie a little touchy
Reviews.Author: staccato
Reviews.Content: I've been getting used to my Bloggie and just when I think I've got it down I have go back and review procedures. It's picture quality is excellent. I haven't played any video back through a TV yet so I'm not sure how sensitive the mike is. The digital zoom is predictably herky-jerky. The small size and shape of the Bloggie allow me to stick it in a pocket and it's probably the camera that I'll have around when something interesting happens that just needs recording. What I won't be doing is taking it on vacation. The instructions are very clear that the camera is not splash-proof, dust-proof, can't get too hot, is sensitive to being dropped or impacted. Sounds pretty delicate.

Reviews.Title: still unsure
Reviews.Author: jenn378
Reviews.Content: My husband bought me this for christmas, and I still am unsure how I feel about it. I almost returned it at first, but then decided to keep trying. It's taken alittle time, but this camcorder is growing on me! I was missing out on recording so many memories because our mini dvd camcorder has never really worked that great!!!So with some more time I am sure that i can fiqure it out! The nicest thing is you can charge by usb, so you do not need to carry around an extra cord all the time, and it loads directly onto the computer, no need to buy memeory cards!

Reviews.Title: Expected More.
Reviews.Author: James A. Nichols
Reviews.Content: I had really high hopes for this camera.  I have used a couple of the flip cameras in the past and this sounded like a step up with a true HD recording(1080) and with a 12.8 MP camera that also can take pictures while you are recording with out messing up the video.  I love the camera and the video is excellent.  I also love the touch screen.  In these aspects this camera is way better than the flip video cameras.Where this one lacks is the software is not that user friendly and I found myself really disliking it.Also the camera wont come on everytime you push the power button (I missed the first couple of minutes of my son being born because the thing wouldnt power on)Last I have had a hard time keeping the camera charged.  I plug it the flipout USb arm into my computer and it has stayed plugged in for a day and it still shows no charge. I cant tell if the camera is charging or not.Overall just an average video camera with a 12.8 MP camera.  Software is lacking and battery and power problems.  I would go with a flip camera first especially if they update from 720 to 1080 on their cameras.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use
Reviews.Author: tracy
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift but I have enjoyed using it. It is easy to handle and easy to understand the instructions. If you are wanting high end video - this is not for you but I think its a perfect camcorder and camera. I am very happy with the purchase!!!

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch
Reviews.Author: kuhalova
Reviews.Content: Sony Bloggie Touch is an amazing, small size camera with great video capture.For better result make sure to take horizontal video on everything. I adjusted videomy mom took with Bloggie on IMOVIE for mac and it is amazing quality.Loving it and the price is amazing as well. The only issue I had there was no leather casefor bloggie, sony only offers three choices for this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Wysmom
Reviews.Content: I was trying to decide between the Sony Bloggie and the Flip HD. The Bloggie had a special offer attached and I decided to go with it based on that and the reviews. I am not disappointed. The video quality is great for a portable, compact recorder. The only negative is that it does not have a low light setting. However, for the reason we bought it (filming our son's sports), it has worked out beautifully.

Reviews.Title: A very nice pocket cam for on the go
Reviews.Author: Water Monkey "Marc B."
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I typically don't buy Sony products.  They tend to be overpriced and force you to purchase their proprietary accessories. My opinion has changed after using the Bloggie.  When I got this camera the first thing I asked myself was, "Is this a camera, or video camera?"  I have still cameras that take video and video cameras that allow you to take still pictures; I wanted to know which category this fits into.  After using the Bloggie  I would put it in the category of a video camera that can take pictures.The first thing you notice about the Bloggie is it's slim and sleek profile.  Sony opted for a smartphone appearance rather than the often cluttered multi-button interface of most cameras. There are only three buttons on the camera (power, video on/off, and shutter click).  Most of the controls are handled by the touch screen.  The touch screen menu system is clean and easy to access.  I have large fingers and did not have any trouble making choices on the screen.  The only issue is that I had to train myself to slide the zooming control smoother, otherwise the autofocus would not be able to keep up with the zooming.  But this is an issue you encounter with every video camera.The quality of the HD videos is great if you have plenty of light.  As the light decreases the autofocus often has trouble locating the proper target.  Although after testing the camera a couple of times in a darkened hallway I was able to understand how the Bloggie chooses targets and now the focusing is better.Sound quality is very nice.  I did not experience any clicking noises like some of the other reviewers mentioned.  I even did video playback on the camera and on my PC (haven't tried the HDMI connection to my TV yet).The picture clarity of the still images is okay at best.  A good prosumer digital camera will outshine the Bloggie all the time.  The issues the Bloggie has is that the lense is too slow (afftecting the exposure) and there is no external flash.  You would not make a living as a photo journalist with this camera.  In well lit situations (especially outdoors) the still images are very good.The software included in the camera is great.  Just plug the camera into a USB port and it installs the needed software.  This is convenient because now I can upload pictures from any PC.  Sony makes it a breeze to upload videos and photos to your favorite online social networks.  I uploaded both photos and videos to Facebook with no problem.  This is by far the best proprietary software I have used with a video camera.  Granted I still prefer Adobe Bridge, but this is simple and quick.That said, the Bloggie is not perfect.  There were a couple of issues (mostly minor) that kept this camera from being a 5 star winner.  First the placement of the microphone on the left side of the camera (when held in a horizontal position).  I am left handed and I noticed on a couple of videos either my hand or fingers must have been covering the mic.  I can hear something brushing against the mic. Along the same lines, in one video my little finger on my left hand can be seen as I start the video.  Both of these issues can be prevented by training yourself how to hold the camera.The camera could really use a flash for the still pictures.  I understand that most video cameras do not have a flash, but since the Bloggie is trying to blur the line between video and still cameras, that would be a nice addition.This is a great little camera for the person who finds themselves taking a lot of video and would like to take the occasional picture too.  Its slimline profile makes it great for vacations and on-the-go impromptu occasions.  I wholeheartedly recommend the Bloggie.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price, if it's not defective.
Reviews.Author: Petpeeves
Reviews.Content: Decent camera, great price. Image stabilization was better than expected.  Zoom was worthless.  Awkward to hold it sideways, natural inclination is to hold it vertically, but then the video is sideways.  Took nice video.  I liked the facial recognition. I returned it because it had the loud clicking noise in the video during playback that a couple other reviews mentioned. We could hear the clicking noise while recording when held close to the ear. My sister in law bought the same one and she has not had a problem.  I think they just have a batch of defective ones out there.  My htc MyTouch smart phone is almost as good as the bloggie.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch
Reviews.Author: Geeks
Reviews.Content: This is my review of the Sony Bloggie TOuch TS-20, I owned Sony products.Dont compare this gadget to a Digital Cam-Its purely more on Video Capture-8GB Internal Memory (Not bad, 8GB is just the right capacity)-Few buttons (Video,Still and Power buttons)-Not complicated user interface (Limited Camera options)-One touch Video/Still capture, Just click and capture-Touch screen-Built-in USB plug, Easy Plug-in w/USB Extension wire-Slim case/camera just like my Sony Ericsson U1 Satio phone-Size and weight is just right-Nice to be used outdoors-Video capture-This gadget is better than owning a Video Cam Corder-Video Quality upload in FB is not bad-so far its clear no problem with it-I try video capture indoors with regular lighting is not that bad.Some minor issues to consider:-Video color on the screen is not that good (Poor Color)-No built in Flash, so using this camera in the evening or poor light may effect the picture/video quality.-Not recommended using it indoors specially in low lighting areas-Limited picture/video options compare to a digital camera-A Sony digital cam and this bloggie are not the same so don't expect-This Bloggie don't have much options like ISO,Macro capture,Low lighting-No memory slot, so your memory is limited to 8GB (Well its enough)

Reviews.Title: Love the hardware hate the software.
Reviews.Author: Hai Pham
Reviews.Content: I also own the minohd flip(2nd gen) so I had high expectation when I decided to pick up the new bloggie TS20.The design is nice, the screen is big and the sound mic is good at picking up sound. The touch screen was not very responsive, until I upgraded the firmware to version 1.05. My 2 week old hardware had only version 1.01.Firmware upgrade is Easy to do if you were able to find the directions on the Sony web page. Sony poorly design their web page.I did not like Sony software to much. Reviews.Title: Does a good job
Reviews.Author: drebbles
Reviews.Content: Product Overview:The Bloggie Touch Camera functions as both a video camera and a camera that captures still photos - in fact you can shoot video and take still pictures at the same time. The camera uses the MP4 format which allows you to upload the video or photos to sites such as Facebook, YouTube, and Flickr. It features a 3.0" LCD touch screen so you can easily search for your photos and videos. It has a built-in USB arm so you can connect the Bloggie directly to your computer to upload videos and photos. The Bloggie records up to four hours of HD video and has 8 GB of internal memory.What I like about the Bloggie Touch Camera:The Bloggie Touch Camera is very easy to use. I have the Flip Video Camera and the Bloggie Touch Camera is much easier to use, especially the record button. I love the fact that you can use it as both a video and still camera - it is much easier to carry around just one camera. The pictures and videos come out nicely and quite clear.  Both the video record button and still camera button are easy to use. It is easy to choose which video to upload and where you want to upload it. It is also easy to upload the videos to places like FaceBook and it takes very little time. The touch screen technology is a lot of fun. Having the USB arm attached to the camera is another plus as it is one less thing to carry around. The Bloggie Touch Camera is slim and fits easily into a pocketbook or even a pants pocket.What I don't like about the Bloggie Touch Camera:While it is nice having a built-in USB arm, the connection is very flimsy. So flimsy that I never could connect it to my computer without the camera falling off - I use the camera with my laptop. The button for recording is right above the USB arm and I accidentally hit it more than once and started recording while trying to connect the Bloggie to my lap top. There are a lot of icons on the Bloggie screen that can be a bit confusing. There is no flash option so unless you have the proper light the picture/videos can be dark.Bottom-line:The USB arm issues aside, the Bloggie Touch Camera is a nice video/still picture camera that is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Handy Videos but not a Camera Replacement
Reviews.Author: Tanya McHenry
Reviews.Content: What can I say about the Sony Bloggie Touch? Well one the highlights is the device is very easy to use.  I mean you have a lot of camera's out there claiming ease, and then I get calls late in the evening from my relatives who are trying to figure out how to use them. I think the videos look very good too, I mean this little device is a great HD camera for novice purposes and easy to use so why only 3 stars? Well I will be happy to tell you. First, the Bloggie arrived on my doorsteps virtually unusable. I cannot tell you how excited I was to rip open the box, see one of the most delightful little black boxes I've seen come with a device in, well ever, and then turn on my Bloggie. It pretty much went downhill from there. The touch screen was unresponsive, clunky and so poorly implemented that I wound up reading Kanji after my first few attempts. My Japanese is pretty poor but not non-existent so I wound up, after several awkward attempts of getting the device to reset to default settings. Kudos to Sony for providing a way to get back to default, but shame on them for shipping a device that was unusable out of the box. I understand that firmware updates are a standard, but you would think you could at least use the camera before having to hook it up to a PC right away. You can't in this case; the touch screen software was that bad out of the box.  The other problem is that the camera still shots, pictures, have this terrible orange tint to it in low light. Now I know what you are going to say, what you are thinking. This camera doesn't have a flash. I realize this, I really do but the thing is, if you take video in the same light, the camera doesn't have this problem. It is so bad that I cannot use this camera in my house at night under artificial light.In summary, this is a really fun device for videos AFTER you update it, but barely even mediocre for pictures.

Reviews.Title: Nice size, Poor video quality
Reviews.Author: LoveMyToys
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like the Bloggie Touch.  Right out of the box, I loved the look and feel of the Bloggie Touch. The brushed metal and chrome in a small form factor felt substantial and expensive. The capacitative touch screen was responsive and the camera turned on and was shooting within 1.5 seconds. Although the Bloggie Touch only has a mono-microphone, the sound quality was surprisingly good. Voices were natural and, even when shooting in windy conditions, I didn't really have a problem with the audio tracks. The camera is simple to use.  Other than setting the video and photo qualities (720p at 30fps, 720p at 60fps and 1080p at 30fps), there were no other settings to play with.  Sony was definitely trying to steal a page from Flip when they designed the Bloggie Touch.Unfortunately, the Bloggie's actual video quality is poor, regardless of which setting you use. Most of the video footage I took in outdoor conditions was overexposed and most of the indoor video was had an unacceptable abundance of pixilation, compression artifacts and evidence of over-aggressive post-processing by the Bionz sensor.  The colors were also blown out.  To get an HD look, the camera seems to compensate for the small lens by artificially pumping up the color (making them excessively vibrant), increasing the contrast and using heavy-handed digital edge enhancement, which gives images an artificial look and feel (lots of jaggies and very dirty looking). The images also lacked detail--except when the camera was in macro mode (it did pretty well up close). While these issues create a less than satisfying image when the camera is in focus, the true downfall of this camera is its horrible (truly abysmal) autofocus mechanism.  In more than two hours of test footage that I shot in indoor, outdoor, bright and dim environments, the camera was out of focus 60-70% of the time.  When the camera is in focus, the image quality is acceptable for a low cost pocket camera, but it takes almost two or three seconds for the camera to lock into focus.  This doesn't sound like much, but if you're following a subject and moving the camera (even with a gentle, slow pan), the camera is constantly adjusting the focus and never achieves a lock.  The result is blurred images--that look good for a second and then slips back out of focus.  Lowlight conditions (which, for this camera, is basically anything indoors) wreck havoc on the autofocus causing images to blur to the point of being unwatchable. The camera also has a tiny lens and a huge sensor, so all of the images look noisy and pixilated--even under the best shooting conditions using a tripod.  Sony was going for specs to make this camera look good on a spec sheet and didn't worry about the quality of the video output.  Sony should have pairs this lense with and 8 mega-pixel sensor instead.  The only good shots I was able to achieve where using a tripod, outdoors, shooting slow moving/fixed objects with the sun to my back.  Given that this is a camera that's meant to fit in your pocket and is meant to be used on the go, that really makes this camera unuseable.I had the bloggie for two weeks, but ultimately had to return it.  This camera doesn't hold a candle to an iPhone 4.  There are many better choices for similar money--including a few real 2010 model year HD camcorders that are now being cleared out and even Sony's own Cyber-Shot DSC-WX9 (which only costs $20 more) is superior in every respect.  I replaced the Bloggie Touch with a JVC Everio GZ-HM300, which is available for $195.00 on Amazon (and can be found for less online). If you must have a true pocket camera, I would strongly suggest getting Kodak Zi8 or Kodak Playsport Zx3 (both are much cheaper and provide significantly better image quality).

Reviews.Title: What I expected vs what it delivers
Reviews.Author: plokiju
Reviews.Content: Pros:Image stabilization works well.Video compression is good, not pixelated or grainy.Pocket sized.Feels solid.So simple to use.720 x 60 fps videos look great.Built in USB is ultra convenient.Cons:No optical zoomNo lens cover.Slow auto focus (5 - 10 seconds)Indoor videos are grainy and yellowish.The vertical video orientation is uselss and gets in the way.1080 setting is useless, unless you keep the camera static.The sound is very weak, because the mic is pointing up.There are plenty of reviews on this camcorder, so I'll just focus on what I was expecting, and what it delivers. First, the video feature on my still camera is terrible, so I had to get a dedicated camcorder. This performs way better than my cell phone or still camera, and it's small enough to fit in my pocket. As is typical of a Sony product, the build quality is very good. The body is made of plastic but it feels solid.The 1080 feature was the major reason I chose this model, but the performance was underwhelming. The image would smear and blur when you panned the camera slowly, and the digital zoom turns the image into a blocky mess.Fortunately this has a 720p at 60 fps setting. This setting looks really great. When panning, the video is sharp, and clear.  The digital zoom is much better at this resolution, with some blockiness at the max zoom (4x). At half zoom, the image still looks good. You can zoom while recording, something my cell phone can't do.With a name like Bloggie, I wasn't expecting much in terms of image quality, but I was pleasantly surprised. The image is bright and colorful. The CMOS tends to give everything a slightly yellow tinge compared to my Fujifilm CCD camera. The exposure seems to be a bit over exposed. Some details tend to get blown out. For example the flower petals lack details from overexposure while the darker leaves look OK. This is really a minor issue and is not a deal breaker. The still images and videos are not overly compressed, so artifacts are not a problem.As others have stated, the auto focus is really slow, so I was expecting this problem. It's not that big a deal unless your focal point is constantly changing. It's  really slow when the scene is dark. It took almost 10 seconds in a dimly lit room. I think most of the processor power is devoted to face recognition, because it's quick to find faces.This is not a high quality consumer camcorder, so it's not appropriate for a graduation ceremony or a wedding. This was intended for casual videography, and it's perfect for those youtube moments.I can say that this is the easiest and most convenint camera to use. Press one button to turn it on, and press another to take still images or record a video (two separate buttons for still, and video record). It's small and thin enough to fit in your pocket. The still images are good, and the 720 video is very good. Without a doubt this is my favorite camera, and the first one I reach for.

Reviews.Title: Lovely Outdoor Video Cannot Make Up for Myriad Flaws
Reviews.Author: Glenn R. Howes
Reviews.Content: I want to like this device, and in many ways I do like it. It's light and convenient, and when moderately well lit creates lovely crisp high definition video, and erratically nice stills. If I didn't have experience with other devices, I might even love this device. But I have experience with other devices.I carry an iPhone 4, and I can say without reservation that iPhone 4 users will have no use for this camera. While the Bloggie can generate 1080p/30 video, therein ends any advantages it might have against my phone. The phone can take HDR stills, has a more responsive screen, allows network uploads of video and stills, allows for in device editing, is easier to use, has GPS tagging of content, an LED flash, has touch to focus, has better white balance, has a more robust viewing environment including pinch to zoom and doesn't have an intermittent odd clicking sound over some video (the auto focus motor?). I'm sure many high end Android and Windows Phone 7 users will find the same lack of value.Having said that, this camera is markedly better than the piece of junk in my wife's iPhone 3G S, and is superior to the cameras in the current generation iPod Touch, so conceivably, users of those devices could find this camera useful in a supplementary role.As an iPad user, I was disappointed that I cannot directly import media from the Bloggie onto my iPad via the Camera connection kit. The iPad complains that the Bloggie wants too much power.Other problems include: It's too easy to cover the lens with your finger; a ridge around the lens would have fixed this. The shutter button is flush with the case and generally hard to use by touch alone. Similarly, easy to cover the microphone accidentally. Low light images and video have absolutely horrible white balance. Digital zoom is too prominent and easy to accidentally activate; you rarely want to use digital zoom if you are going to edit the video anyway. Mac users will often get a bad eject warning after removing the device as there is a useless software distribution partition which will have to be ejected separately from the media partition. And it's useless for Mac users as its only use is to launch a website with a promise of future Mac support. And the volumes are formatted as FAT32, which while an understandable choice for maximum compatibility does limit video capture to 2GB per video, which is not long at 1080p.Also, this camera shoots 12 megapixel stills. I know this is an industry wide problem, but who thinks it is a good idea to have such a large number of pixels married with such a small lens, short focal length, and correspondingly small sensor area? Don't people realize that using a 5 megapixel sensor with its correspondingly large sensor elements would result in less noisy images and better low light performance. I implore camera manufacturers to not put anything more than 5 megapixel sensors into any camera smaller than a micro four thirds format. As it is, I have this thing set at generating unnecessarily noisy 2 megapixel images; I'm not going to be printing movie posters from these images, please try marketing to the educated consumer.The good features include. Really nice image stabilization. Will charge in an iPhone/iPod wall charger. Amazingly accurate realtime face recognition. Decent compression at 100 MB per minute of 1080p. Works well with iTunes. Decent battery life. Doesn't show motion as "jellyvision" artifacts like the Flip HD camera I sampled earlier in 2010. Has a tripod mount threading on the bottom.But, sadly, I cannot possibly recommend this camera. The bar is just too high. Save your money and put it towards a high end mobile phone with a decent camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: There were many pros about this product, but there were a few things that I didn't really like.Pros:Great QualityEasy to Carry (size)Takes Videos AND PicturesEasy to OperateSound Quality is GreatI love that it gives 4-Hours of recording time.I used this to go to Disney World and it captured my experience in such a great way. The only problem I had was that it took TOO long to autofocus. While watching over the videos, it would be blurry for a long time and I couldn't make out what was going on. Another thing is that it randomly froze while I was recording and it started to heat up. It wouldn't turn off. I waited for about 10 minutes until it completely shut off.Overall, great product.

Reviews.Title: Used a a "boat camera" and misc.
Reviews.Author: Wade Guisbert
Reviews.Content: The focus is a problem, but then again I am not using this to film a documentary. I paid about$70.00 for it. I stick it in a water proof case while on the boat, and in my shirt pocket when around family events. It works!

Reviews.Title: Just okay. Not worth the praise everyone gave it.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth A. Delaney "elizabethamber"
Reviews.Content: A pro photographer friend recommended this device to me after extensively asking me about my uses as a podcaster. Since I needed a better camera than what's on my cell phone and has a better battery, I need stills and video capability. I worked using the stills mode over the weekend and the shutter speed is awful. From the time I push the button there is 2 seconds delay before the picture is actually snapped. There's no way to capture people without them looking elsewhere by that time or getting decent candids. Out of about 20 photos, 3 were too blurry to even post.There was also almost no instructions whatsoever. I plugged the device into my pc hoping a digital set of instructions would come up but instead I got to an app for SONY that wants my credit card information for billing me for some account I don't want. The information makes it sound like it's so easy to share images and files but it isn't at all. I didn't want to give my credit card information even for a certain amount of "free" storage so I didn't get to test the uploading out. Just trying to make an album was awkward in that software and then changing a name on one of the built in contact lists didn't let me go much further; I changed the name of "My Best Friend" distribution list, then what? There was nothing to enter their email address, cell phone number for texting an image, nothing. It's a clumsy tool.I also couldn't find any way to make the camera front-facing which would be especially useful for people looking to essentially have a better version of what cell phones offer these days.I had bigger expectations for this overall. It's compact so I can use it easily but the features and ease of use are seriously lacking for a SONY product.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: bunnyhollow
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because I was looking for a cheaper alternative to a FlipCam, which I've used previously. This camera is small, lightweight, and easy to use, but has a few major issues that made me regret the purchase.First and foremost, this camera has a really difficult time auto-focusing. I was filming some kids who were moving around a bit and almost ALL the footage is out of focus. It sometimes takes a full 4-5 seconds to focus, and by that time my subjects are out of frame doing something else. Also, as some other reviewers have mentioned, the microphone is placed incredibly inconveniently so it is often covered by fingers when holding the camera in a natural position. Finally, the only way to charge the camera is by plugging it into a USB port on a computer, and there is no indicator when the battery has reached full charge.If I had to do it over again, I'd have spent the extra money on an HD FlipCam.

Reviews.Title: Grandson loves to take videos
Reviews.Author: pensive4now
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my grandson who is having a great time taking videos with it.  Quality if very good, especially for the price.  He's dropped it a couple of times (which I don't recommend) but it's still working fine which speaks to the quality of the product. It's very easy to operate as well.

Reviews.Title: Camera very useful and handy
Reviews.Author: Connie Gohata
Reviews.Content: The Son Bloggie Touch is very easy to use and carry with me.  It is convenient and ready at any time to start "shooting" when I need to.  It is so much easier to use than pulling out my cell phone, finding the camera program, pulling it up, and finding the start button!  it's ready to go!

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Brittiny
Reviews.Content: This product is nice for what it's supposed to do.  I like the quality of my videos that i have recorded.  Hoping to experiment with it some more.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, very high quality for a low price
Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  It is easy to use, has great features for the price and the clarity of the photos is remarkable.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: pamslittletouches
Reviews.Content: Great product! Is exactly what I was looking for. This camera has great features my daughter loves that it takes pictures as well as videos. It is easy to charge and download.

Reviews.Title: ERasy to use
Reviews.Author: Hank G
Reviews.Content: Nice unit .  Takes good videos and average sound.  It is a little pricey, overall its a well made product  Very portable and easy to carry and store.

Reviews.Title: Неплохой камкордер
Reviews.Author: VLADIMIR VNUKOV
Reviews.Content: В новых смартфонах сейчас характеристики получше, но, тем не менее аппарат имеет право быть.Из несомненных плюсов– полностью металлический корпус.Быстро стартует. Не нужен USB кабель (но надо быть аккуратным, чтобы не разворотить USB-порт. Особенно на ноутбуках). Есть порт HDMI mini (так и не пригодился)Довольно интересный комплектный софт. После установки которого предварительно выбранные на девайсе фотографии автоматом загружаются в выбранные соцсети. Но можно вполне обойтись и без него. Определяется как флешка.Пишет в mp4, соответственно на iOS всё играется без проблем.Батарейку держит нормально. Конечно не 4 часа, но 2,5 часа активного! (по зоопарку ходили) использования продержался.

Reviews.Title: awesome!
Reviews.Author: ed
Reviews.Content: best deal anywhere. at best buy it was over $100 so it was a steal. perfect and new. highly recommended

Reviews.Title: it works
Reviews.Author: demens
Reviews.Content: The video is average. It is sony so it moves smoothly. Still have not been able to set it up with my computer. Could be windows Vista. I've been unable to locate a discussion regarding this on my computer.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch Camera
Reviews.Author: Pam
Reviews.Content: I think this is very very good product.  I previously bought a Flip Camcorder which I actually still have 2 1/2 years letter.  I wanted to get a new one in case the Flip did not work anymore. As you know the Flip is not made anymore.  This Sony is very fun to use & I just love it.  I was not aware when I purchased it that it also was a camera.  It takes very good videos and pictures.  Great price for the $$$.

Reviews.Title: Got this for field work and its great!
Reviews.Author: JW Purdy "JW Purdy"
Reviews.Content: I know its a waste of the Bloggie's purpose but I bought this for taking photos of homes during inspection. I wanted a camera without a telescoping lens for a good price and I am more than pleased. This little pocket sized dream gives great image quality and a very wide angle of view. I got it just before the holidays and was able to take great videos and easily edit and post them to the web. I would recommend this to anyone for light photo or cinema work.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Blind Wolf
Reviews.Content: It's awesome for straight classroom presentations.The only problem with it is the auto focus gets a little wonky if people go in and out of the shot too often.

Reviews.Title: Second One
Reviews.Author: wise tech "mlm_phx"
Reviews.Content: This was recommended by a friend, and I bought it to try it out.  Another friend saw me using it and asked me to purchase one for her, which I did.  It's easy to use.  Picture quality is great and upload is easy.

Reviews.Title: bought for a class project
Reviews.Author: tim smith
Reviews.Content: My daughter needed a video camera for a class project, this fit the bill perfect. Easy to use, quality is ok for the price, your not going to film the next Sun-dance film on it, but for easy to use stuff this fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jerman
Reviews.Content: My expensive digital camera with video capability had problems.  The sound was missing on the videos.  The repair was going to be at least $175, so I looked elsewhere for a solution. I decided to purchase the Bloggie instead of repairing the digital camera.  What I like about the Bloggie is that you can take still pictures while you are videoing.  You can also zoom while videoing, but it is a little blurry during that instant.  My problem is keeping my fingers from the front of the lens.  It is compact and easy to carry.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: Mr Shot
Reviews.Content: Camera was a gift.  Individual receive really liked the features.  Has great HD 1080capabilities.  Touch screen is great.  Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: Kayla
Reviews.Content: I have previously owned a flip camera, after it broke I wanted to replace it and instead chose this camera. I am very pleased with my purchase. The camera has a very slick appearance, loved the fact that it zooms a good distance, and has good software. We haven't hooked it up to our hd tv yet but there isn't a doubt in my mind that the video is going to look awesome! The only con is the camera quality is almost the same as a (cheaper) cellphone...but that doesn't really bother me considering I have a dslr camera also. Would totally reccommend this camera if you are looking for a small camera to carry around!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Happy Mom
Reviews.Content: My son needed a camera to take video's of his robotic creation and I wanted one to take pictures of his senior graduation.  This camera does both. And connect to the computer with ease.

Reviews.Title: excellent!
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Hilliard "Tom"
Reviews.Content: absolutly love it, easy to edit movies with windows software, or any software you may have (mp4 format) takes great video (understand that this is not a professional video camera).  For the price of 60 bucks you are not going to go wrong.  great for vacations etc...  I use it for my dojo to video the students during class so that they can see what they are doing to critque them and they can get the video downloaded onto a flash dirve in a jiffy and keep for themselves.

Reviews.Title: Even I can work it.
Reviews.Author: Bank Of America "Robert Duncan "old man""
Reviews.Content: I have had the Bloggie for a few weeks now and I am still amazed what it will do.  I took a pictureof an old photo of my four grandchildren taken Dec 23, 2000, it is now my computer desktop photo.Guess what one thing they will get for christmas.

Reviews.Title: Bloggie
Reviews.Author: Roland Adams
Reviews.Content: Dose not focus right when recording, the play back comes out blurry. So i do not recommend this camera at all.

Reviews.Title: Just the right size
Reviews.Author: Theodora Wachtler
Reviews.Content: Since I don't have a cell phone I find this camera to be just the right size for my handbag with out being too heavy.It takes a very good picture.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch Camera
Reviews.Author: Susie
Reviews.Content: love this camara, best video, easy to use. I have never taken such nice pictures. Audio works better than I could expect

Reviews.Title: Great and cheap
Reviews.Author: Mendel
Reviews.Content: The camera work very well, much better then i expected. My only compliant is that the focus could work better.  overall great camera great price!!!

Reviews.Title: very handy
Reviews.Author: Dr BS
Reviews.Content: In full light, this device takes excellent HD video with decent sound.  I've had no problems at all with it.  Its HDMI out works very nicely too, so that you can just plug it into the TV and watch.  The camera does have a few downsides: (1) poor low-light performance.  There is a ton of image noise in low light and it looks like you're shooting on a 1st gen cell phone camera.  (2) poor stills.  Not too important, as that's not really its job, but important in that this can't really be your "all-in-one" type device.  If you're, say, on vacation and want great pics and video, you're better off taking the DSLR and shooting your video with that.I think this camera's real value is for those of us with babies who often are looking to grab a camera quick because baby is doing something cute.  Much quicker than unlocking a phone and finding the camera app, then switching to video mode.  It is on and recording almost instantly.  Also love the flip-out USB plug.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working
Reviews.Author: Alex Goodlive
Reviews.Content: It stopped working after a month. It was decent while it did work, but after this short amount of time, to die like that already is just unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: love it...
Reviews.Author: eugene joseph
Reviews.Content: this camera meets all expectations except the lighting , but other than that its a great camera , i would get this camera for only little blogs or other small things .

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A. Herrick
Reviews.Content: Sooooooooooooooooo easy to take video and stills!  It fits in my pocket and survived a few times when I dropped it.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Sharon V. Richardson "MadMom"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my granddaughter and her husband to take on their trip through the southwest.  They loved it!  It performed exactly as promised.

Reviews.Title: Find it quite limiting
Reviews.Author: Oceanminds
Reviews.Content: although the video quality is quite nice I have to admit to be turned off by the touch interface and the lack of interchangeable battery. You have to plug it in and wait to charge before using it again. The flip cam was so nice with its simple AA batteries...

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch Camera
Reviews.Author: Eric Biggers
Reviews.Content: Great camera and  recorder for the money.  This camera is easy to use and very compact.  We would recommend to you for an affordable camera and digital recorder.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: RE broker
Reviews.Content: I took this to the Panama Canal and the video was great.  Great Value for the money. Nothing like it on the market

Reviews.Title: bloggie review.
Reviews.Author: Charles Murphy
Reviews.Content: whats to say,this little bloggie is the bomb. it shoots beautiful crystal clear videos and stillshots.the zoom is very good for close ups,the audio is good. anyone who is thinking about buying a sony bloggie,i suggest you do so.you can carry it in your pocket. BUY ONE!

Reviews.Title: video camera
Reviews.Author: bb
Reviews.Content: Worked very well for me, fantastic picture on camera and on tv.8gb held more than enough pictures and video for me.Battery life is very good .only dislike is i wish it had a slide show when replaying on tv and does not work well in low light

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie video camera
Reviews.Author: Wee Willy "Wee Willy"
Reviews.Content: Great little video camera at a good price.  Smooth videos and you can take clear pictures snapped while videoing. Convent pocket size.

Reviews.Title: GREAT ITEM
Reviews.Author: V. ROMERO "VICTOR ROMERO"
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A WONDERFUL CAMERA.  IF I WERE TO LOOK AT THE FAULTS WITH IT, I WOULD SAY IT WOULD HAVE TO BE WITH THE AUTO FOCUS.  SOMETIMES IT IS SLOW FOCUSING.  I ALSO DO NOT LIKE THE FACT THAT AFTER 30 MINS OF TAPING, THE CAMERA AROMATICALLY STOPS RECORDING.  IF YOU ARE DOING A LONG RECORDING, YOU HAVE TO KEEP YOUR EYES ON IT TO MAKE SURE IT IS STILL RECORDING, AND RESTART AFTER THE 30 MINS.  OTHER THAN THESE TWO THINGS, FOR THE PRICE, I GOT IT FOR $65.OO.  YOU CAN'T BEAT IT. NOW IF THESE TWO THINGS WERE SUCH A BOTHER, THEN I WOULD SHELL OUT ANOTHER 100 BUCKS.  NOT!!!  GOOD CAMERA AND THE BEST IN THIS PRICE RANGE.  SONY PUTS OUT QUALITY AND IT DOES NOT LOOK OR FEEL CHEAP AT ALL!!!!  JESUS BE WITH YOU ALWAYS!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Value and easy to use it
Reviews.Author: Javier / Peru
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to catch everymoment of my 10 months boy, it is very easy to use it and the HD quality is superb. The only low is in low light condition quality is reduce.

Reviews.Title: Good quality viewing, bad autofocus
Reviews.Author: MoonShine
Reviews.Content: At first, I was entirely intrigued by this product. It has very good video quality, even the picture taking is exceptionally clear. I love the fact that I can take pictures WHILE I am shooting a video. It's a good size, lightweight, and has a nice, sleek design to it. The bad thing is the damn auto focus, it constantly gets out of focus when i first start recording, especially when it's a lot of movement. I record a lot of boxing and mma fights and I get frustrated when the quality gets blurry when the focus gets lost. Another thing I noticed is that when I watch the videos on my laptop, there is this weird clicking sound and I'm thinking it's the auto focus trying to adjust. Overall, it's a good product, just a few flaws. For me personally, I think it was an okay investment. I just press the shutter button before recording and it stays pretty focused. For those who are planning to shoot really important videos or semi-professional videos, this is definitely not for you.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!!
Reviews.Author: The_Juggernaut_Nick
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera from the third party seller yesterday. Have to say ADORAMA CAMERA lived up to their reputation. Product got here wayyyy before the expected arrival date and is absolutely amazing. The video quality as well as the picture quality is stunning. And so easy to share stuff too.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but ridiculous file transfer method
Reviews.Author: Dan Ho
Reviews.Content: The camera's Android like user interface is great and the video/picture quality are good.  The video and picture look grainy when zoom in completely on an object 15' away.  That wouldn't bother me as much as that I have to install Sony's software in order to transfer video and pictures from the camera to my pc via the USB connection.  Sony's engineers couldn't find a way to make the camera appears as a storage device so that a pc can recognize?  Given the history of Sony on the rootkit debacle, I just don't trust Sony on installing any software from them.

Reviews.Title: High hopes; but let down
Reviews.Author: Robin Clarke
Reviews.Content: Video jumps when played back on PC. Photos don't match to the expected resolution of 12M. OK, I suppose, for cheap and cheerful memories, but I'm already thinking, after a week, that I might as well carry around a slightly larger compact for better results, flash, and optical zoom.

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: DN
Reviews.Content: Got this for my mother in law.  Needed something that was not complicated , but takes relatively good video.  This fit the bill, and is very compact.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal on Small Video Camera
Reviews.Author: Victoria A. Warfield "toree"
Reviews.Content: For the money, this little camera is awesome! Easy to use, easy to upload, easy to have on you at all times. It also takes pretty nice still shots. The only drawback might be that it is a bit "jerky" when zooming or panning. I'm very glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch Camera
Reviews.Author: Mikeylikesit
Reviews.Content: This is a great product for the price.  It is easy to use and takes high quality HD videos and pictures.  It comes with the PC software on the Bloggie that is easily installed on your PC or Mac.  From there, you can manage, share and store all of your pictures and videos.  It is compact and easily transported.

Reviews.Title: Works fine but does not stay on past 29 minutes
Reviews.Author: YCTRS
Reviews.Content: This product is good, but for anyone who wishes to record for longer than 29 minutes should get a different product. Besides for that its small and compact.

Reviews.Title: A great travel camcorder!
Reviews.Author: Cinnamon Hollow
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Sony Bloggie Touch Camera, 4-Hour (Black) to take with us this fall on vacation. I've done a few test videos to see how it is going to handle different types of light. It works great outdoors and gave really vibrant color. Indoors, the photo quality is a bit dark because there is no flash, but I can easily bright my photos on my computer.The battery life is great and has held through all my testing. The Bloggie Software is a bit bland but it allows you to view your videos and photos as well as share them with your social media and family/friends so it is good. It would be great if it had a built in editor. It would also be great to be able to do some minor editing and sharing right from the Bloggie.It is a great size, fits in my pocket or purse and it very easy to hold. I LOVE the touch screen. The features are easy to use. The Bloggie auto flips from horizontal to vertical when you change orientation. However, in vertical mode, there are black sidebars which are a bit annoying. It would be nice if it had an auto adjust to make it fit the screen in vertical mode.One other feature I wish it had was a dual camera (like on the iPad 2/iPod Touch 4, etc.) but that isn't a con, just a wishlist.Overall, is a very nice video camera and will be perfect for our trip!

Reviews.Title: A Nifty Little Pocket Camcorder
Reviews.Author: Hope
Reviews.Content: This nifty little pocket camcorder is just what I expected at this price point. I was recording right out of the box, as the unit is basic and self explainatory. It would be nice if it had a port for an external mic, which would allow for better outdoor or distance sound capture. The software is also very basic, I found it to be somwewhat slow to act when prompted. Easier file naming for later retrieval to other programs would be a nice upgrade as well. The software also has a tendency to crash a bit, thus forcing the user to close the program, and restart it.Aside from the software glitches, however, the picture is in beautiful HD, and has a brilliant picture quality, especially in a well lit or outdoor setting. Low light situations, however, don't look very good and are somewhat grainy. I like the size of the unit, and the slickness in the design. IT's a classy little unit. Overall, I'll give this four stars. I'm having a lot of fun with it, and if you like to do YouTube videos, this nifty little camera is perfect for a YouTube newbie such as myself.
