Reviews.Title: It was a good buy
Reviews.Author: Carlos M. Garcia
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a HD camera and video recorder and the sony bloggie fit the bill very nicely. with the 12 mp the pictures come out nice and the video is great. only con is that in low light it's not as good but for the price you cant beat it.

Reviews.Title: great little camera/camcorder
Reviews.Author: stroud6
Reviews.Content: Got this not really knowing what to expect.  Had looked at the flip video but decided to go with a sony.  Glad I did, takes good pics and video.  However keep it on the higher settings for quaility.  Has enough storage to take plenty of pics or videos.  The only thing it does not have is a flash.  It would help on indoor pics and videos.

Reviews.Title: A Little Wonder
Reviews.Author: Alan Mattock
Reviews.Content: The Sony Bloggie Touch camera has fulfilled my high expectations, based on previous experiences with Sony products over the last 44 years. It is extremely compact, but proved to be easy to use and yielded excellent photographs, both still pictures and video. It is very solidly built and should prove to be durable. I look forward to using it on my travels.

Reviews.Title: Compact and easy to use
Reviews.Author: Ian Butteriss
Reviews.Content: I love the compact size, metal case and touch screen operation. The ease of zooming is also a plus. Just slip it in your back pocket and forget about it until you need it!

Reviews.Title: Excelente portable camera
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: This camera is an excelent pocket gadget, the files are in mp4 so can be edited easily. _I recomend this product for peaople who want to have a portable video device. It doesn't have optical zoom, but it is the price to have something smaller.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Linda Ann Joslin "texaspm"
Reviews.Content: We used this camera at a conference.  It was easy to use and results were really good.  I recommend this camera, especially for people that are not computer wise.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie
Reviews.Author: M. Hanley
Reviews.Content: Easy to use and off loads easily to our MAC. Only issue Sony needs to address is for a smoother transition when zooming while recording. Really like the photo while you record feature.

Reviews.Title: Best pocket size camcorder
Reviews.Author: R.A.Skeete
Reviews.Content: Pro's:It's light,easy to use and has great battery life,plus you get 12mp pictures with 1080 video  Con's:It take's long to auto focus(loses a star for that)  I wanted a digital camera and seeing that this was also a camcorder at $99(refurbished)cud not turn down the deal.I am glad i purchased this camcorder,thou it does not have a light for night shots,it is great in the day and at night(if you are in good lighting).It's easy to get your finger in the way of the lens,so you have to learn how to hold it,and when you have that down you have to learn how to hold it without blocking the mic,and when thats done you have to learn to work with the slooooowwwwww auto focus,after you have mastered these thing's,you can enjoy the light,easy to use bloogie touch.O'yeah dont forget the awesome touch screen,it's just cool:)

Reviews.Title: Already Made a One-Hour Travelogue Movie
Reviews.Author: A. Villarica "phasertone"
Reviews.Content: Just be aware of backlghting. The auto focus will fumble in this condition. Otherwise, I am very happy with this camera. I bought it in a store one day before our trip to Cancun. I already made a movie using an old software and posted it in You Tube & facebook. I just stitched the videos one ofter another and inserted scene effects in between. Tip: make sure that the still photos that you will incorporate in your movie are in 16:9 aspect, as well! May I add that throughout our trip, I carried the camera in my pants pocket!

Reviews.Title: Must buy!
Reviews.Author: kevin5DmarkII
Reviews.Content: Bloggie is definitely worth the price! Powers on super fast and simple straightforward interface makes it easy for anyone to just pull out and use to document whatever might be going on around you. If you're looking for quality in a small package and convenience this is definitely for you.

Reviews.Title: good camera with some flaws
Reviews.Author: Tai
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. The only thing about it is when you are recording in a quiet space, you can hear the clicking from the auto focus lens trying to focus. it is also recorded, so playing back a movie will also have this. but its only when the room is super quiet. no problems really outside, unless its super quiet. youtube the clicking to get an idea of how annoying it is.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera But...
Reviews.Author: Mus man "Jon"
Reviews.Content: This really is a nice video camera. I would love to give it four stars but what is up with the focus!!! It is so annoying! Sony please sort this out... it is making your good camera in to an okay camera. It also does not have a flash! It is easy to use and the software is easy to use on my Mac but I find it hard to just email the videos to people. The picture quality (when it can focus) is great and the sound is okay. I do not understand why they put the mic where they did because I keep putting my finger over is accidently. The battery stays charged for a good while. I am going to keep it for a bit longer and see if I can deal with the focas. So it is a nice camera and easy to use with no flash and a difficult focus. Be aware!----------------------------------------------------------------------------Update: I have just returned the camera..I needed to get a quick shot and it took 30sec just to focas!!!I am done with this!

Reviews.Title: Family pics
Reviews.Author: studioprod. "Roberts"
Reviews.Content: While it boasts HD, this device is aimed at social media...swapping family pics, etc. The software is decidedly unsophisticated and made for sending cute videos of the kids frolicking with the dog and posting them to folder pre-named Mom and Dad (I'd have to do a bit of digging to get the videos to where they are) and other categories aimed at the Super Average Family with 2.3 children living in Anytown USA. The camera itself is fairly capable, but trying to use the video files in a sophisticated (or even simple) editing program is clumsy.The auto-focus overrides everything. There are no manual settings...just idiot-proof settings guaranteeing mundane images.We needed to have a number of small HD cameras and the automatic settings just made for lots of mediocre and useless images. As usual, Amazon took them back without complaint (love Amazon). We bought the Sanyo Xacti HD cameras. Amazon had a super sale on the pink ones (some guys online had a Freudian problem with the pink). The Sanyo Xactis produce excellent results for our needs and the videos are almost imperceptible from those shot with more professional equipment. Also, the memory is removable on the Sanyo.

Reviews.Title: Issues with focusing overshadows all positives
Reviews.Author: NickA
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like it and keep it, but ended up returning it due to substantial focus issues.I also did not particularly liked ergonomics, i think it is quite awkward to hold and operate unless holding with two hands.FOCUSING. I do not see how anyone can use this camera unless you shooting non-moving objects. I wanted to use it for sports and interior house videotours and 50% of the time Bloggie is completely out of focus. If you moving from 5' away object to 15" away, you have to stop for 5-6 seconds in order for camera to focus.Not good!

Reviews.Title: Oh YES...
Reviews.Author: Rebecca L. Edwards "Gangurogurl"
Reviews.Content: I'm actually surprised on how the quality and sound is here on this product!I'll have to give this a 5 star.To actually blog with this thing, I mean, that is what the BLOGgie is for! I'm proud of myselfat making the right choice for the year. It's something I've been wanting, but I kept doubting to get.of course, I searched it all up, to see what it can do, and when the shipment finally arrives, I was in awe!to get a great camera foe a fraction of the price, makes beauty.

Reviews.Title: Surprisingly good
Reviews.Author: Luving it
Reviews.Content: I want something I can keep in my pocket at all time when I don't have the DSLRs. Tried Canon Elph before, didn't like the photo quality.Pro:1. Simple to use - video, photo shoot while recording video, moving files to computer, on camera review, build-in USB connecter, etc. Inspired by iPod, simple interface gets the job done.2. Surprisingly good photo quality. Claimed 12mp is not as good as my Canon 5D but far better than my other bigger and more complicated/expensive point/shoot cameras, in low light.Con:1. Common problem with the modern devices: phone, iPod, and this one - too shiny and slippery. Could have put some rubber around the edge for more assured hand held.This is definitely a keeper for me. The flip video one sold for similar price in Costco. Went for Sony for the peace of mind. Hope I won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Slow to focus
Reviews.Author: Soheila Soheil
Reviews.Content: Although the dimensions and size is what I like, but it is not very ergonomic,I attached a small (table) tripod for better holding while shooting video. Otherwise it is very easy to drop it.It is also slow to focus, compared to my old Flip.Also, once connected to a Mac it will not be recognized by another PC or laptop running Window.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY but..
Reviews.Author: JDOG739
Reviews.Content: Pros: video,picture,touch screen,size,design,priceCons: software,low light situations,battery  Well over all this cam is great not awesome but great. the video quality is really crisp and clear. The pictures are also nice. Probable the best pictures I've seen on a pocket cam. the touch screen is cool but not always responsive and the only reason i put it by the pros was because i thought it was a nice feature.The side is great for my pocket and the price is just right.  Now the software for the cam is pretty jank because when you play them back they look and sound horrible so i wouldn't use the software to show others your videos.The low light videos aren't the best but show-able.Now you can get 4 hours of video just not at one time.I'd give it a 4.2.Personally think that it is the best pocket camcorder.hope u like it:)

Reviews.Title: Five stars for video, four stars as a camera
Reviews.Author: Leanne
Reviews.Content: We've had this for a few months, but I've waited to write a review so we could use it in many conditions and describe how it's worked in each one.  It really is a great camera!  While the picture quality isn't that great just as a camera, it is fantastic for videos.  Here are more details about this product:Pros:*  Simple, easy-to-use interface.*  Great videos with a really nice zoom (maintains good quality when zoomed).*  Simple software included (for PC's) that supports easy uploads to Facebook, YouTube and Flickr (right out of the box, it is hooked up to these sites).Cons:* Bad photo quality. Photos are grainy and dark.*  No flash on the device (Please note: this doesn't affect the video...it shoots great video, even in dark places!).We've used this in all types of conditions, from filming children to other activities. Just to give you another example, most recently, we used it to film a robotics competition my husband's high school students were in.  That competition took place in a dark sports arena, with lots of yelling and with lots of quick movements of the robots.  It took amazing footage that was sharp, and the background screaming and yelling wasn't as deafening on the video as it was in real life.Overall, it's  great little device that is perfect for filming!

Reviews.Title: Great LIttle Camera!
Reviews.Author: toddtravels
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for several reasons.  1) I sell new homes, so I figured I could do video tours.  I haven't used it for that yet, but will soon.  2) My full-time job is working as an instructor for an airline.  It's so easy to just use this camera for short little videos that can be inserted easily into PowerPoint.The quality of both the photos and the videos are outstanding.  But like others have said, be careful where you put your fingers because you could cover the microphone.

Reviews.Title: Love this product
Reviews.Author: jojo
Reviews.Content: I absolutly love this product it is everything and more. I can video record as well as snap pictures while recording. You can play the video back on the product, the computer, or on your big screen tv. Love love love I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Great
Reviews.Author: samg
Reviews.Content: I received it two days ago. I love it, contrary to some negative reviews I think this thing is great. I have a small tripod that I can tilt the head so the Bloggie is in the correct position for video. Video is very good and I dont have any problems with zooming. The soft ware is very good too. Best money I have spent in a long time. My son and I have a video business doing weddings and such with our $5,000 HD cameras not suggesting the Bloogie is as good but it sure is great for around the house and out and about.  I love it and would recommend to anyone wanting a small HD video camera.

Reviews.Title: cool toy
Reviews.Author: fuxonballz
Reviews.Content: this is a very cool product.  video quality is awesome the interface is idiot-proof and beyond self-explanatory.  the only thing i think could improve is the sensitivity of the touch screen because you use it to zoom.  there may be an adjustment for that i haven't found yet.  irregardless ;p this is a very cool toy and i would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Carrielavonne
Reviews.Content: I have had my bloggie for a couple weeks and I love it!!!!  So easy to use and the perfect size to carry around with you!

Reviews.Title: 1080p in the Palm of Your Hand!
Reviews.Author: diljs
Reviews.Content: With the success of cheap, portable, simple camcorders like the Flip Mino, classic camcorder makers are scrambling to recapture this market segment.  The Sony Bloggie Touch improves on some mediocre previous attempts bearing the same brand, and turns out to be a very easy to use, powerful, fun little camcorder.Some Highlights:-Big 3" touchscreen is fairly responsive and simple to use-1080p recording - Currently the gold standard for video,-8gb of storage provides "up to 4 hours" of video, at a lower resolution of course.  One can easily strike a balance between quality and recording time, however.-12.8 MP Still Camera - Means you don't have to carry a separate camera if you want a still rather than a video-Mini HDMI output for viewing on televisions or other HDMI devices-Integrated social networking software - hassle free uploads to Youtube or Facebook-Autofocus works well-Very few buttons to fiddle withCons (Most of these are common on this type of product):-Charging can only be done through a USB cable-No expandable memory-No optical viewfinder-No optical zoomOverall I think this camera is good at what it does.  There is a lot of competition in this area of low priced camcorders, and the Bloggie is a worthy opponent.  You can't go wrong if you're looking for a simple, portable way to record HD from the palm of your hand.

Reviews.Title: good buy
Reviews.Author: orlandomom
Reviews.Content: fir what it does its a great product, however it is annoying sometime to wait for upto a 1min or more for the screen to focus and get the shot. Its very easy to use, super easy to upload/ down load pic and video's plus you dont have to carry 2 camera's. good buy

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Miller
Reviews.Content: After shelling out 300.00 for this at a Duty Free shop in South Korea (go figure, the camera is made in China but costs double what it does in the States) I have not been able to get the software to work and have had nothing but problems trying to download it from Sony.Also, I have had problems editing the video I took. You need to download a converter.The auto-focus is a pain, though the lens is excellent.Not worth the 300.00 bucks I paid for this camera.

Reviews.Title: I made a mistake buying this one
Reviews.Author: James R. Watson "Jim Watson"
Reviews.Content: If you want a camera for great videos then this is the one. But if you want one for snapshots as well this is a total waste of money. It is very difficult to get the camera to focus and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Ankur Gupta
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nice product of Sony, handy and great deal for this price... Video quality is awesome...I find every thing great in this camera except zoom functionality... I love this product!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Mini-camera
Reviews.Author: H. Etchell "haretanan"
Reviews.Content: I have several significant cameras and have a need for a small camera to carry and shoot when I am not carrying the larger cameras. After reading many reviews on most of the mini-cameras, over several months, I decided to purchase this one. I can only say it is fantastic. No, it does not replace my larger cameras, but an excellent second choice. Great movies, long lasting battery, and very portable.

Reviews.Title: Love my bloggie
Reviews.Author: T. Parks "Shoppie"
Reviews.Content: Its the perfect size, very cool and sleek. amazing zoom,I would recommend it to anyone. My only complaint is the lack of a flash which means it does not work well in dimly lit places

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch
Reviews.Author: peter
Reviews.Content: This is a good piece of gear, 4 hours of HD video ( can we call it video now?), the only problem I've encountered is the Sony download, it will not download ALL the Sony site to my computer, so I only have the basic tools, I cann't see how to download movies to my documents and then to a DVD, Sony will not reply to any emails for help on this matter. I'll just keep on trying...................

Reviews.Title: Great for Price
Reviews.Author: A. Mckeee "proudinfidel"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Camera in need of a compact video camera.  I got above the Flip because it shoots in 1080p & it was cheaper.  Pros = Great Size, Great Video Quality etc.  Cons = If shooting in 1080p it takes awhile to upload to your PC, Facebook & Youtube.  Did great when we went skydiving.

Reviews.Title: The amazing Bloggie Touch
Reviews.Author: m.g.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product because I decided it was time to start recording family events.  First I must say that the bloggie is a very slick device and is very easy to use.  Video and photos come out excellent, but results are noticably better when your in well-lit areas, since the device has no flash.There will always be better products coming out, but don't be afraid to jump onto this one and give it a try.  btw go with the 8gb model...why not ;)

Reviews.Title: Not exactly pleased
Reviews.Author: D. Salfen
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed.  Videos in day light next to impossible to track moving subjects on flat screen display (sun/background reflections).  Without a sighting lens/window don't even try.A practical low battery warning - is non existent.Expected more.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: Camcorder shoots video in great detail, but only in good light. Poorly lit spaces will be grainy and pictures will have a "burned" appearance. Software is very minimalist is not perfect. For some reason my Vista OS can't recognize that it has already installed the built-in software, and it let the autoplay option show up. Fixed this doing something weird. However, videos are nice and make for good videos; pictures are amazing wide angle shots (with good light.) Good battery too, much better than Flip.

Reviews.Title: Better than MinoHD (2nd Gen) mainly due to IS
Reviews.Author: Erich Maria Remarque
Reviews.Content: I have a 2nd generation MinoHD to compare this with, and it's kinda hard to figure out which one is better mainly because they have considerably different advantages and disadvantages.So to put it simply:MinoHD advantages over Bloggie- Better audio. Both Bloggie and MinoHD have this constant "humming" sound, but it's less noticeable on MinoHD.- Slightly more natural colors. Bloggie videos have a yellowish tint in low light conditions. However, video quality is identical between the two when shooting in sunlight.Bloggie advantages over MinoHD- Image stabilization. I cannot stress enough how important this is. Unless you use a tripod to shoot videos, the Bloggie should be your first choice.- Longer warranty. You get 1 year warranty with Bloggie instead of 90 days with MinoHD.- 1080 full HD capabilities. I don't really consider this a huge advantage though. Personally I keep mine at 720 resolution with 60fps.- Ability to take pictures. This one is useless, as the device doesn't feature flash.Otherwise these are both identical in the way they function. Both have a built in USB connector, both record in MP4 format, videos in both can be accessed without any special software, and both suck at recording video in low light conditions.

Reviews.Title: Bug of MHS-TS20
Reviews.Author: Csha66
Reviews.Content: When you remove MHS-TS20 from your PC USB port "without" the self remove option, MHS-TS20 will be "crashed".The phenomena of "crash" are:1. Can not be powered on.2. MHS-TS20 will heat up to 40Z.3. PC can not recognize when plug in USB again.

Reviews.Title: might as well get cybershot camera or any other camera
Reviews.Author: J Lim
Reviews.Content: i have the sony cybershot, and that has HD video capability, but it has a 29-minute limit to the videos. i called sony to find out how to override this limitation, and i was told that this limitation was implemented because the cybershot is technically a camera, and if it didn't have this limitation it would technically be a camcorder. so i bought the bloggie touch, which is technically a camcorder. imagine my disappointment (and rage) when i bought the bloggie touch and discovered on the very first test shoot that it also has a 29-minute limitation. i called sony again, and they simply apologized, offering no reason for this limitation. DO NOT BUY THE BLOGGIE. BUY THE FLIP MINO 3RD GENERATION. the flip mino has a 1-hour limitation, but it automatically restarts the recording so that if u leave the camera recording, it will record 2 hours of video automatically, without u having to touch the camera. and it costs half of what the bloggie costs. the bloggie is a nice looking camcorder with ABSURD feature limitations.

Reviews.Title: Convenient, basic video recorder with a few limitations
Reviews.Author: Lieven Leroy
Reviews.Content: Simple and effective overall for recording basic clips. Record quality is good, the UI for basic actions is straightforward (though for more complex actions, the menus/etc. are not intuitive).Other reviewers have covered those basics in detail, I'll add two items I did not see mentioned which were (for me) notable limitations: - Record time: Total record time on a single charge was about an hour at default settings. Not bad, but - for a device with no other purpose - not great, either. - A single recording cannot last over 30 minutes. The device stops recording, with no warning tone, at that point. You can hit record again, but if you didn't notice it stopping, you may have missed something you wanted to record. - Can't charge while recording: While there is a convenient USB connection on the device, when it is connected to either a PC or a wall charger, it does not work as a camera or video recorder. This makes it hard to plan when you may run into trouble because of limitation 4: - No on screen battery indicator till the device is almost out of charge.

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: Riss
Reviews.Content: I was weary given the price, would it be cheap? Would it break? Would the video quality be shoddy?Much to my pleasure I can say it is worth it. I use it to keep in my car, or bag and whip out to catch funny family moments to mash up in a quick little video for mild amusment and it does this job well. The quality (if you use a video editor that can enhance the production a bit) is good enough, the ease of which to handle it? Not so much. It takes some getting use to and I wish the surface was a bit less smooth so I would have something to grip better; but by far my biggest complaint would be the USB drive. By Gods that part is so utterly cheaply made it stresses me out everytime I am forced to use it.Aside from that though, it is a good camcorder; least for the reasons I use it.

Reviews.Title: Frustrations!
Reviews.Author: Marci Moran
Reviews.Content: Buyer beware!  We lost our Flip camera and decided to try this one instead as a replacement.  BIG mistake!  Does not stay charged so seems like every time we pull it out to use it the battery is dead.  As a result, we end up using video feature on our phones more than this.  When it does work, picture is often blurry and download is a pain with the Bloggie software/website.  Another negative is the annoying video that plays every time the battery drains, plus you have to reset settings.  Not a fan!

Reviews.Title: Terrible, Terrible, Terrible!
Reviews.Author: atilolp
Reviews.Content: Prior to having the bloggie I owned an HD flip cam.  After a lot of usage, it's life ran out and the flips were discontinued. My husband did a lot of research on handheld cams and decided to get me the bloggie. I was super excited at first as we have a 1-year old and i wanted to record every moment. Sadly, the camcorder takes about 8-10 second to focus, so those first seconds are always blurry. Second, the zoom in option is toach-screen (you have to move your finger up a bar) which sounds fancy, but it's the worse. Every time i want to zome, I have to stop focusing on the object to find the bar and then my finger either moves it too close or too far and because i'm putting more focus on the zoom bar than the object, the entire image is distorted - as a consequence, I don't use the zoom anymore. Third, when you download the videos (let's say you've done a months worth of videos and you might have downloaded some to share on FB but not all), when you go down to download to store (in my case in order of date because I'm a bit type A), it doesn't tell you when they were taken. I'm now desperately seeking a new camera and will give this away for free to ANYONE - i HATE IT. I've stopped making videos and will only make unless i absolutely need to. If you have any recommendations on any other cameras please do let me know!!! I'll pay anything at this point - I don't get the time back with my daughter so the money is irrelevant at this point. I wish Flip would make their cameras again :(

Reviews.Title: Obviously....
Reviews.Author: Ryan James Ilg "RJ"
Reviews.Content: Obviously you get what you pay for. And for the small price this camera packs a punch. Its HD quality is tripped up, however, by a jittery autofocus and a poor external mic. All in all, I probably would save my money and buy something more expensive. In this case, you certainly get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Great filming, Worst PC software
Reviews.Author: Kowari
Reviews.Content: I had this camera since December in replace of my old Flip MinoHD first Generation. The Sony Bloggie was better in HD filming and the still photos are acceptable. Two things has disappointed me with Sony Bloggie 1- it has the worst PC Software ever it is not a friendly use and you cannot chage the location of saving your clips. 2- The Sony Bloggie has bad filming quality in low light.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch Camera 4 hours
Reviews.Author: R.Kho
Reviews.Content: This product is verly easy to used, I am somewhat satisfied.A few thing that I don't like were:1. It should have a removable battery, so that I can replace the battery if I am using it some where and ran out of power.2. It should have a memory card slot.Hopefully Sony will add these items.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Software, Passable Video
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Fred"
Reviews.Content: There's a love-hate relationship with the Bloggie: the software that comes with this innovative camera is completely useless to me. I've never gotten it to work on three different computers and Sony's customer service comes close to being the worst I've ever had the deep displeasure of interacting with. The online CS chat must be manned by chimpanzees.Every time I execute it on any of the computers I tested, it errored out instantly. The CS chat told me initially that this was because Sony does not support it on 64-bit OS, such as the Windows 7 laptop I was using. I thought this very fishy so I tried it with a 32-bit Windows XP and Windows 7, both of which errored out as well. I've given up on using it.Now the camera: It's a nice camera with a clarity problem taking video in anything but clear sunshine. How bad? Well, it's not terrible, but it shares this dastardly characteristic with some other cameras I've tried. This isn't saying much as Sony has a pretty good reputation with graphics and video and one would expect they would do better than be content to be counted as best amongst the worst.Working the camera also presented a problem: I found I almost always had a finger cover part of the lens in landscape mode. Then again, I could just have fat fingers, but the placement of the lens was such that if you naturally holding it, the risk of covering the lens was high. This wasn't a problem in portrait mode, which the camera switches between quite easily.In good lighting, I really liked the quality of video and the relatively large viewing space. I found I never use the digital zoom on the touch-screen because it results in low-quality video (yeah, don't use digital zoom, ever. Walk closer) and I also really liked the ability to take still shots during video recording although for some reason--perhaps outlined in the manual?--the stills were bad to terrible quality.The lens gathers and keeps dust and I had to spend quite a bit making sure it was clear. This wasn't a problem I'd had with some of the other cameras (such as the Kodak Zi8). I also didn't like the fact Sony did not ship the Bloggie without a case.I'd like to give this Bloggie five stars, but all the problems have combined to knock this one down to three stars.

Reviews.Title: does not last four hours
Reviews.Author: tgtbt
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend bought this camera so we could film our favorite bands concert. We specifically got the four hour one so we could make sure we had enough battery life. It lasted at the most an hour and fifteen minutes!!!!! The thing died and we couldn't record the whole concert as planned! So if you want to buy the bloggie because of how long it records be ready for it to die after less than an hour and a half. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Love my Bloggie
Reviews.Author: MELISSA FERREIRA
Reviews.Content: This product is great. I needed it to tape footage of my daughter at her basketball games and it's done fantastic so far. If you're thinking this video camera will double as a good digital camera....think again. I'm very happy with the video quality, but the photo quality can use some upgrading. I have a regular digital camera that I use for still shots so it really hasn't affected me.I really love this and I recommend this to anyone who is considering a small handheld video device. The LCD screen is larger than the competitors screens which really makes video taping enjoyable.Downloading the videos is a snap as well. Overall it's a great product.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: HECTOR
Reviews.Content: I bought a refurbished item and I am happy with it. Easy to handle and no need to read instructions if you are familiar with this kind of electronics.  It perfectly fits my pants' pockets.  Videos are in HD and they look like a movie when watched in my 32" TV.  Pictures taken with this device are so so if lighting is not good.  Videos are good even in poor light conditions.  The sound is standard.  Plug the camera to a computer using the USB port to charge the battery.  I don't like this since I have to turn on my computer, just to charge it.Pros:-  Very easy to handle.-  Good video quality.-  Fits pocket's pants.-  Easy to admin the files.-  Touch screen-  Excellent image stab.-  Good size of screen.Cons:-  Case, battery charger and HD cable not provided.-  The microphone is located on  a place where I usually put my fingers, causing that some videos are recorded with no sound.Conclusions:Considering that I bought it to record videos of my 3 years old daughter, this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Focus-pocus
Reviews.Author: Dana Armstrong
Reviews.Content: As many others stated before me, the auto focus on this camera is frankly TERRIBLE. It will foucs crystal clear and then move your hand just a fraction and it re-focuses only to blur. You have to remain perfectly STILL for this thing to focus on anything and even then 9 times out of 10 it's going to remain blurred.It's great for a quick "oh the cats are being cute grab the camera on the table to capture a quick moment" and hope you get it. It's handy to plug into a usb port, but if you want HD quality consistently? Do not buy this. I am rather disappointed overall.It's OKAY, it takes movies on par with cheap Cellphones but it's still a crap shoot for HD quality consistency. I expected so much more from SONY.If you just want an easily portable, blurred is good enough video capture and so-so photos with ease of fitting into a pocket this is for you...if you were hoping for HD captures of precious moments... invest in a better camera. I'm sorry I bought this thing.Oh and the microphone? IT'S IN A TERRIBLE PLACE if you want to hold this in your left hand... you will accidentally cover up the Microphone and your audio is DRASTICALLY impacted. I don't know how many times I've forgotten and switched to hold it my left hand and my audio cut out until I put the camera back into my right hand again.

Reviews.Title: Sony bloggie 8GB
Reviews.Author: Bertha soto
Reviews.Content: This is a great product. The video clarity is fantastic. The touch screen is especially nice and easy to use. It was a great value also.

Reviews.Title: good but ...
Reviews.Author: nelsonyrg
Reviews.Content: this product could be better with a some kind of ilumination included, the video format its mp4 and this could be ap roblem for some players, And a little more zoom would be good. By the possitive side have a good size very small, the touch screen its great, its easy to use and have a hdmi output

Reviews.Title: Worth the purchase
Reviews.Author: H. Butler
Reviews.Content: I've purchased 3 different Sony Bloggies.  The Sony MHS-CM5 Bloggie, the Sony MHS-PM5 Bloggie, and the Bloggie Touch.  This is one is the best.  It's quick, easy and the video and picture quality are amazing.  If you are in the market for a "Flip" type of video camera, spend the extra money and get a Sony.Over Christmas I was comparing mine Sony Touch to my friend's Flip HD.  Sony won hands down.  Quicker start up, better video quality, easy to use, and very versatile.  The picture quality is excellent too.  Another plus is no need for the extra memory card.  Some might frown on this because they want the space, but 4 hours of video is plenty for me.  With my other camera's I purchased 8gb of memory, so the fact that this comes with it built in is excellent.The only thing I wish it had was lighting.  But this would just be an add on.

Reviews.Title: small package small performance
Reviews.Author: charbud
Reviews.Content: A very neat package but the ease of use is not good and the photos taken are of lackluster quality. There are, no good operating instructions supplied making it a long drawn out process to feel comfortable using it as your primary camera. Does not live up to Sony usual quality.

Reviews.Title: Sony blogger software extremely user-unfriendly
Reviews.Author: Roman Pennington
Reviews.Content: The biggest problem with this device is probably the software Sony bundles with this unit that is supposed to make it so "easy" to upload your videos to the web.  My friend videotaped a few short 5 minute segments and then proceeded to download them to his PC using Sony's software.  It convolutes the location and uses bizarre filenaming conventions to store the files on your PC, rendering it extremely difficult to find and identify the video files with any other program (using filenames like "import26349983627561"  WTF?).Anyway, we get the videos on the computer and try to upload them to a YouTube account, follow all the instructions and Sony's bloggie software responds with "File too big" - that's it.  FU.  Your shiny new camera can't be used with YouTube.  Buh-Bye.YouTube's file upload limits at the time of this writing are maximum 15 minutes and up to 2GB file size.  Is a 4 minute video shot on the Bloggie more than 2GB in size??  After some exploration on the PC, I finally find the video files (again which are named with bizarre filenames that have no relation to what the video contains) and the size?  184MB.  So why can't it be uploaded to YouTube?  Clearly, Sony's bloggie software is lying to us about the limitations on uploading this video to YouTube.We managed a work-around by manually uploading the files to YouTube outside of Sony's software, but this creates a significant problem because after awhile, all the video files are obscurely named and virtually impossible to identify on disk, and nowhere in the Sony software does it give you the filename.  Sony also uses the same filenames but with different directories further compounding the ability to organize the videos in some meaningful way outside of its very limited software.This unit is unfriendly and very limited in its functionality.  If you thought you could get this and easily upload videos to popular (non-Sony) web sites, think again.

Reviews.Title: Don't listen to the idiots
Reviews.Author: killmurer
Reviews.Content: Okay, like what you're doing right now, I did a lot of research before buying this item. I've bought lots of stuff before but trust this pocket camcorder by far had the most number of idiot haters. Instead of a normal review let me try and put some things straight. These are some of the reasons why people hate it..1. The auto focus is horrible.2. It doesn't have a flash.3. Low light performance sucks.4. Clicking noise when recording.5. Stupid tripod mount.6. No expandable memory.1. This is the least stupid of the lot. I agree there are better auto focus systems out there. But then again you are not buying a 500$ camcorder. So don't expect to easily compose shots like a lone flower with the rest of the scene blurred out. This is NOT a dedicated camcorder. Instead use the auto focus to your advantage and know that it'd focus MUCH FASTER if the whatever you wanna focus on dominates the screen (daylight makes focusing even easier).2. Bloggie produces the best still images in the pocket camcorder class BY FAR. It's 13 megapixels for gods sake. It's well in the digicam category. There are lots of camcorders out there that doesn't even let you capture a still image let alone in 13MP resolution.. Like *cough* flip *cough*.. And people still want a full xenon flash in this thing? Next thing is the battery getting drained due to the flash and more people whining about low battery life.3. This is another funny thing. I mean seriously. This thing has among the best low light performances in the segment. Way better than flip. Keep in mind this is a 150$ pocket camcorder. DON'T COMPARE it to something 5 times its size and cost.4. Most moving lens system would make some amount of noise while it moves. This is true for all pocket camcorders with a movable lens system. STOP placing your finger over the mic and amplifying the internal lens noise and you'd be fine. NO clicking noise no nothing.5. There are tripods that actually swivel 90 degrees. The bloggie would only work on that.6. This is up to you guys. Personally I love not wanting to carry those little cards around. And I find 8GB more than enough for me. Another thing is that the built flash memory is fast enough for 1080p vid recording you don't have to worry about buying cheapo cards thats not fast enough.If you still need a 50$ camcorder with Xenon flash, 15MP stills, 1080p video, 100 hour battery life, 30x optical zoom and want it in a size smaller than a cell phone. Just wait 6-8 years and let the technology catch up to your idiotic dreams.This is what I think :Among the best in class quality video in daylight.Best in class low light performance. (NOWHERE NEAR DEDICATED CAMCORDERS but can give some cheap digi cams a run for its money)13 MP stills... mhmmm do I really need my digi cam?Full 1080p recordingAuto macro for that close up shots and videos.Still image capture while recording. (This is really easy technically, I have no idea why the manufacturers dont put it in)Very small size + touch screen + looks cool!5 stars because this is THE BEST IN CLASS by far.

Reviews.Title: Does not play in synch in Bloggie software
Reviews.Author: michael reuss
Reviews.Content: HelloStay away from this product. The audio noise other people have complained about is there! Number two if you play recorded videos in Bloggie software the video and audio is not in synch. However if you take the same files and play them in apple quiktime they play no problem. This is a problem for when you upload files and clean space on the cameras drive, you are unable to place files back on camera to view on TV or other. The product also does not focus well. As others have said it searches for focus all the time, giving you a non desireable video.Having said this the camera is pretty and works but the software is herrendous!!

Reviews.Title: Dec 2010 Consumer Reports Recommends Earlier Bloggie MHS-CM5, Tied to Your Computer for Charging
Reviews.Author: Mayflower Girl "amazon-junkie since 1996"
Reviews.Content: I'm beginning to agree with some of the other reviewers in that with the great capability of all of the SmartPhones, how many of us still need a separate digital camera/camcorder?  Still, with a bunch of young kids, I'm often taking movies of the young'uns, so I was excited to have this.  This is maybe my fifth or sixth digital camera and fourth digital camcorder.  This is the first of my digital camcorders to have a touch screen--a feature I absolutely love.  Of course, the problem with a touch screen is smudges--but it's something I'm willing to deal with for the touch screen ability.This little camcorder is amazingly stylish.  If looks are a big thing, then you'll love it.  Resolution is great.  Storage is great.  Software seems fine to me as well.  Easy to use--designed to let you post to YouTube or Facebook in a flash.  The lack of flash hasn't impacted me yet--although I'm sure it will.  Not sure how I'll overcome that.NOTE: The only way to charge your Bloggie (at least that comes with it) is via a USB cable. I find that very annoying. Couldn't they at least include a regular wall plug? I can see myself out travelling, and having to hook up my netbook just to charge this camera.  What a pain!  You can buy a USB Charging Adaptor from Sony for $24.99.  They'll give you 15% off if you register your Bloggie, but still that's a steep amount for a plug.I received the 2010 December Consumer Reports today and they recommend two earlier models on Sony (ranked #2 and #4 of the pocket camcorders).  The Bloggie MHS-CM5 is #2 and earns a 53, just behind the Kodak PlaySport Zx3.  The Bloggie MHS-PM5 is #4, and earns a 52.  Although this Bloggie was out before the issue went to press, it was not included.  Still ,the fact the both Bloggies were recommended gives me confidence in this model. The one thing that the previous models had that this one does not is a little screen/lens head that you could flip out.  I think that would have been a great feature to keep.  One feature that this does much better than my Kodak is take good stills.  With my Kodak, I felt like I always had to have either my separate digital camera or my phone ready.So for me, the Bloggie is an improvement over my last digital camcorder in terms of resolution, for that I'm happy.  Still, in a few years when my kids are older, I doubt I'll use anything other than my phone to take 99% of all videos and pictures.  I'll give Kodak credit for including a wall plug though. Heck, even iPods come with one.  Is Sony so cheap? The flash issue is also a big oversight. I haven't experienced the clicking in the audio, though.*What to do with old cameras?*If you're like me, and you have quite a collection, you might wonder what to do with your outdated ones.  Besides giving them to friends/relatives/kids, I highly recommend looking into nonprofits that use them.  RAWA is an organization in Afghanistan that helps women fight domestic abuse--and wants digital cameras and camcorders.  Ask at your local school/YMCA/boys/girls club. They may want them either for a digital photography class or for teachers to use.  Ask at Domestic Abuse shelters, etc.  eBay has a page called the Rethink Initiative (just Google it) which can help. Try and find a good home, and if you can't, check with the manufacturer about recycling opportunities.

Reviews.Title: Focus .... please focus  Very Disappointed
Reviews.Author: unbiased reviewer "horriblemongo"
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to buy this and I choose it over the Flip because it offers 1080 quality.  I filmed my daughter's Christmas concert with it - what a waste.  The camera will not focus properly, the digital zoom is terrible.  I thought maybe the lack of focus was due to the fact that I was filming a large group of people and the camera just didn't know what to focus on, but I've seen the same terrible quality with videos I've taken around the house.
