Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch Camera, 4-Hour (Black)
Reviews.Author: mohammed a saqib
Reviews.Content: i am very very disopointed it does not work at  its rip off i want to return it i hate it it has many scratches and does not work at all i want to return it totally disliked it

Reviews.Title: Terrible excuse for a camera
Reviews.Author: Jillian Kramer
Reviews.Content: Well, the only positive thing about this camera that I can say is that it turns on. Other than that, this is a complete piece of garbage. Most smartphones will shoot superior video, and the still captures are grainy and awful.Focus is laggy which usually means you'll miss the shot. The provided software is an absolute joke. Seriously, I thought Sony made quality products, and then I used the Bloggie. Save your money, there are many superior products out there. This is a sorry excuse for a device. And since the technology is instantly out-dated, the Bloggie is most certainly a throw away piece of junk.Sony -- I expect more.

Reviews.Title: sony?
Reviews.Author: joseph r bateman
Reviews.Content: shame,shame. software that goes with it sucks. would have to spend more money for extra software to make it work right.

Reviews.Title: Tick, tick, tick, tick, tick...
Reviews.Author: DJ Cassel
Reviews.Content: Why would you produce a video recording device that also recorded the ticking sound made from the camera?  How does this make it past the designing stages?  I love that it doesn't have cords.  I love the size and visual quality.  I love the touch screen.  I HATE that frelling ticking sound!  Seriously!  FAIL.

Reviews.Title: An ok camera, but nothing to write home about.
Reviews.Author: Ernestine Kopp
Reviews.Content: The camera works well, but to get full-screen video the camera must be held in the horizontal position while filming.  Filming with the camera in the vertical position causes black bars to appear on each side of the finished video.  That totally sucks.  Years ago Sony would have never sold something like that.  They've totally lost their design edge.  And though attractive, the camera's smooth, shiny, somewhat slippery case does make it easy to drop.  Word to the wise...be careful not to accidentally cover the microphone holes with your left index finger, which is easy to do.  It generates clicking sounds in the video.

Reviews.Title: Bloggie is horrible- i want to return it
Reviews.Author: Susan O'Sullivan
Reviews.Content: this is a horrible camera! most of my images are coming out blurry even the video is blurry at times. i'm a part-time photographer so it's not operator error. Additionally, the button to take a picture requires a lot of pressure to make it work and then there is a delay before the photo is taken. Very difficult to capture my active toddler with these issues. Furthermore, there is no flash. I would like to return the product as I just bought it but the seller refuses to even listen to my concerns. if you could help me that would be most helpful. I buy a lot of items from Amazon and love it but this has been a very bad experience.thank you,Susan O'Sullivan Sellers

Reviews.Title: Several issues with this camera, only after a few months of use.
Reviews.Author: Lindsy
Reviews.Content: I really don't like this camcorder. I never bothered to return it or anything, so it's my fault that I am stuck with it. It was a birthday present from my dad, because I had a baby on the way and he wanted me to have a nice camera to record all of those special moments! I can see that a lot of people are happy with this camera, but you have to think that - they might have not had it for very long, and never bothered to update their review when they DID start having issues.Within a couple of months, I started having issues.1) The first problem I had, was that I got lines across the top half of the screen for no reason.2) The usb got stuck and wouldn't come out.3)As for picture quality, this camera is horrible unless pictures are taken in daylight. In dim light, pictures are blurry or fuzzy. In overhead lighting, pictures turn out completely washed out in yellow/orange.4) In the background of all of my videos is a clicking noise.4) Last but not least, it has a VERY hard time focusing if there is too much going on in the photo. Often times, I have to go right up close to whatever I am trying to get a photo of, and slowly back away.I wouldn't recommend this camcorder to anyone. I give it two stars instead of one, simply because it is great for taking HD photos OUTSIDE.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: JGeorge
Reviews.Content: I love this camera when it comes to using it to record my daughter. However, either I am stupid or something but I can not get this thing to upload to Facebook to save my life. I've had it for 5 months, used it for many videos of my baby's "firsts" and can't share them with anyone. :(

Reviews.Title: good overall
Reviews.Author: David Benson
Reviews.Content: Too bad you did not include a written manual for the camera. I wish down loads were simpeler, or worked with other programs

Reviews.Title: Decent but not as good as Flip Camera
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I got this from my brother to replace my Flip camera. Its has nice enough features... can go to you Tube etc. But the color is off a lot. Kind of dull and bleached out especially in inside light. Not as good as Flip camera in this way. But it does do a decent job

Reviews.Title: Fun camera
Reviews.Author: inspector2
Reviews.Content: Camera is nice size and works good after gettin used to it.However it is not much different from an Apple phone which has about the same features.

Reviews.Title: Auto-focus nightmare
Reviews.Author: Shawn D. Kerr
Reviews.Content: I read about the Bloggie Touch on lots of different websites and read quite a few reviews that claimed the Bloggie Touch would be a good purchase for the price.  However, after attempting to make several videos and vlogs I've found that this camera has such terrible auto-focus that the cheap price isn't worth it.  The camera continually focuses in and out sometimes for seconds at a time and unless you're standing completely still the video footage is pretty much worthless.  I have loved Sony for a long time, but after this product I'm no longer going to buy any Sony cameras.  Auto-focus, which you can't disable on this camera, should be a feature that is stable and reliable and should be one of the first features to be tackled.  It shouldn't feel like the auto-focus was slapped together and thought to be "acceptable", which is what it feels like.

Reviews.Title: Great!!!!... But
Reviews.Author: shureshot24
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera. It does everything I want it to do and is really easy to use. It shoots video and takes pictures, Has 4GB of space which is really enough for light filming and pictures, and the touchscreen really gives you more simplicity when using it. But its all dragged down buy 3 terrible flaws. First, there is no light. While I really don't care about this one too much, it makes taking certain pictures without a flash or shooting video without a camera light can be a pain, but this camera does take pretty good low light pics and video. Second, freaking auto focus. God forbid anything walks in front of the camera when shooting a video because the freaking auto focus will go off. Its soo freaking frustrating because there is not even an option to turn it off. I will say though for pics and steady shots its okay. Finally, the stupid tripod attachment for it is on the bottom of the device.  Now I'm not shooting entire videos with this thing but I do shoot some simple stuff with it and when I do, I like to film in widescreen. You when you flip the camera vertical it shoots in a vertically rectangle box that looks like crap and yet the tripod attachment is placed where it can only shot in that format. I had to buy a tripod just for this freaking camera. Overall a 3 out of 5. Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: Sounds better than it is....
Reviews.Author: Evelyn Robertson
Reviews.Content: Easy to video, and I like that you can take a still shot while videotaping, but from the description I thought it would upload directly to social media (specifically YouTube). Not so. First you have to load it onto your computer, then you can send it to YouTube, which it does fairly slowly, and the image quality on YouTube was not great. Another thing I was not thrilled with is that you charge it by connecting it to your computer while the computer is operating and not, apparently, by plugging it into a wall socket. Also, the instructions refer to items that were not included, a 360 degree lens (which I don't care about) and a cable that would make it easier to connect to the computer--if I had that cable, I wouldn't have to unplug my printer when connecting the camera. I would not have bought this product had I realized that I could not actually upload directly or that it could not be plugged into a wall socket to charge it.

Reviews.Title: its okay
Reviews.Author: Lisa F. Walsh-Burr
Reviews.Content: i wish the instructions were better took 50 pictures at a baby shower did not know you had to hold down button to save , after i went back to look at them they were not there, not great lighting

Reviews.Title: Handy but a bit clumsy
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel Boisdete
Reviews.Content: The Sony Bloggie is a handy little camera.  I'm a high school science teacher, and I use it to take quick pictures of my students and of demonstrations to show in home-made videos.  The ability to connect to the computer with a flip-out USB connection is a gigantic improvement over other video cameras.  However, it is also rather limited.  It is kind of hard to turn on and off (the power button is not designed well).  Both the video and the still camera does auto focus clumsily.  I often end up with unfocused images and videos.  Also, the video sometimes goes in and out of focus for reasons unknown.  The upshot: the "intelligent" features of this camera are not too smart.

Reviews.Title: OK, but some software issues
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: As has been mentioned in a number of other reviews, this is almost a great little product - if it didnt have some annoying software issues.The two issues that hold this camera back for me are: i) the orientation of the screen, and ii) the clicking noise when the lens is re-focusing.Orientation:You have to start the camera in landscape mode, and start filming in landscape mode, otherwise the bloggie records in a really weird vertical strip. Its really off-putting, and your video is almost useless.Clicking:Whenever the camera needs to re-focus, there is a strange clicking noise. It is not noticeable when recording, but is a real pain during playback. It kind of ruins the video too.All in all, this camera is close to being really cool, but these two issues kind of ruin it for me.

Reviews.Title: Auto-focus is annoying.
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Moss "Author, TOWN RED"
Reviews.Content: The video is sharp, the interface easy to use. However when my daughter was trying to VLOG, with her as the subject, the auto-focus feature kept going in and out of focus on her face. It would focus on her, then the background. Then her, then the background. Creating video that was virtually unusable.Apparently others have had problems with this feature, too. So caveat emptor!

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, but terrible sound
Reviews.Author: ladybug "dc"
Reviews.Content: Nice size, easy to handle and takes clear pictures.  Now the sound quality has issues.  If there is a lot of background noise in your movie then it is not too bad.  If you are taking pictures of something that you want to explain there is a constant clicking noise coming from the lens when it moves to adjust the picture.  It is very anoyning and it distracts from the enjoyment of watching the movie.  I sent it back.

Reviews.Title: Thread wore out so it no longer works with my tripod.
Reviews.Author: Joshua P. Nichols
Reviews.Content: At first I really liked the camera but after a month of use the the thread wear out. In other words it made this camera incompatible with my tripod! The camrea not working with my tripod due to wear and tear of the thread killed this camera for me. Worked find with it for about a mouth but then it can no longer be used by the tripod. I can literally push the screw in completely in the tread. This unacceptable for any camera especially after a month of use. It almost made it to two.Auto focus can be a pain due to the camera attempting to refocus on the image. I wish you could set it once and forget about. The video quality of the camera is good especially outside.

Reviews.Title: Great for What It Is I Suppose
Reviews.Author: Joel Dauteuil
Reviews.Content: No major complaints I guess (this was given to me so it was free). I've considered grabbing this camera many times on my way out but why? Between your normal point and click camera and possibly your camera phone - aren't you covered?If not, then maybe this is for you. It is great for HD video, the interface with your laptop is excellent so moving video or stills back and forth is brainless. And, it recharges easily and quickly.For me, my Canon Powershot Elph is about the same size, does everything this does and the still pictures are greatly superior on the Canon. If you're like me, you should probably pass.But, if you don't have a new fancy iPhone or compact 'point and click' that you're happy with - then maybe this kind of product is for you.It delivers - does what it promises. And, the view screen is nice as well as the touch screen.My only complaints are really that it may be a little redundant for many folks (like me) and the still pictures were weak.If given the choice to start over I'd pick a Canon Elph every day of the week - the HD video is as good if not better - and the sound is superior too.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing:-(
Reviews.Author: inian
Reviews.Content: Zoom is horrible, they should have had a button instead of the touch controlNo way to Pause and continue recordingDifficult to handle/holdDoes not change orientation (horizontal/vertical) during recordingGood for videos, but pictures not good enoughI am a Sony fan, but on this one I think they blundered!

Reviews.Title: Slippery Little Camcorder
Reviews.Author: N. Congo
Reviews.Content: I've had this camcorder for about 2 weeks, and here is my opinion.PROS:The video quality once uploaded to Youtube is pretty good. I've seen better, but you get what you pay for.It's very easy to use. Turn camcorder on, and press record. It's that simple.CONS:I HATE the way it feels in your hand. The surface is very, very slippery. I never feel as if I have a secure grip.I wish there was a light for low light filming.You have to hold the camcorder horizontally if you want your video to come out without black bars on each side.Overall, I think it's a pretty good camera for the price (I got it for $75). I just wanted a new mini cam to do some vlogging. It's a cool personal cam, and not meant to use for any heavy duty type jobs.

Reviews.Title: Good but not best
Reviews.Author: X. Zhang "Zhang"
Reviews.Content: Sony bloggie Touch camera can take very good video at the bright light, but at the dim light, the quality of video is horrible.It focuses very slowly, and you can not get big images from far away.Good parts: it is small and light, battery and 8GB are good enough.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUT DECEIVING!
Reviews.Author: J. Ives
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera 1 week ago from Sony Style (Sony). I paid $170 plus received a $20 gift code for PSN (Playstation Network).The camera does not record 1080p HD video for 4Hours. All the companies deceive you. Although it can video in 1080p (30p not 60p),it can do so for 1 Hour and 22 minutes. On the lowest 720 HD setting you can video for 4+ Hours. I was expecting the 1080p HD videocapacity for 4 hours. For the price it is a "Pretty Good" camera. It is still a step-up from what I had and sold on Amazon.Pros:SlimLightweightPrice1080p HD Videoing$20 Gift CardPocket-sizeTouchscreenCons:Small Internal memory(no expandable memory)Picture quality is 8MP on Widescreen 16:9 picture.It is only 12.8 MP on 4:3 square picture, who wants that?It is a great camera if you want one and can only afford 1-2 hundred dollars. If you can afford more, buy a better camera, I suggest an HD Camcorder ($400 and up).

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch
Reviews.Author: hrdumagu
Reviews.Content: I love the way this Sony Bloggie can take HD pictures, and HD video. Easy to carry, and easy to use. Overall a great product that I ever bought.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME but will NEVER recommend it to anyone!!
Reviews.Author: Moaz Bambi
Reviews.Content: Just awesome product.my only complains are the low lighting recording.. but that's not a deal breaker by any means....UPDATE Sep.29.2011*Changed the rating from 5 Stars to 2 Stars*BUT on the other hand the deal breaker is:The fact that i MUST shoot in landscape mode to get 16:9 aspect ration which SUCKS!!! i wanna shoot in portrait and have the camera makes it 16:9 (i don't care how it is done, Flip cameras do that!!)I'm gonna sell mine this week and get Flip UltraHD...This TS20 is awesome but the cons are just deal breakers... like the 16:9 aspect Ratio and the stupid most pathetic fact that Sony Cameras can only do 30 minutes and just STOP!!!!! Why the hell is this stupidity ONLY with Sony?!Anyway, i learned my lesson the hard way and will NEVER EVER even think of buying a Sony Camera EVER again!!!Summary:Product is awesome in every way but the fact that i MUST shoot in landscape to get 16:9 is alone a deal breaker and makes ALL the other features absolutely nothing to brag with.. and also NOT worth the price. (Although, i'd still buy it for the same price if it fixed the 16:9 problem and maybe a bigger storage as a bonus << (not necessary)NOT RECOMMENDED!! and gonna sell mine!

Reviews.Title: Clicking noise....
Reviews.Author: Joseph P. Hough "Denver"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality was just ok....but had to return it because of a strange clicking noise (like a reel projector) in all of the videos....I've heard this is a pretty common problem with this item...

Reviews.Title: barely useful
Reviews.Author: natgasvehiclesnow
Reviews.Content: the bad: Herky jerky zoom, any pan has horizontal jump movement, no flash, non expandable memory.the good: ok for photographs,good for still video shots-tripodoverall unsatisfied-gave it to my mom so she could use as mainly as a still camera. Amazing for the size but the lack of using it for quality video falls way short-too bad- the old saying applies, "you get what you pay for"I would not recommend this POS!!

Reviews.Title: Clicking sound -> deal breaker
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: Initial impressions very positive:Sleek designLight weightCompact for pocketsTouchscreen commandsIntegrated with Facebook and Picassa for quick uploadingVery good video in sunlit or very well-lighted indoorsDeal breaker:  Indoor video will make the Bloggie auto-focus churn repeatedly if lighting is not bright.  Upon replay of video on your computer, you will hear a loud clicking from the auto-focus mechanism throughout the video.  I initially thought it was defective.  However, after reading other consumers have the same problem, I see that it's an engineering flaw.So, as long as you take video in sun or well-lighted indoor settings, the Bloggie is a nice product.  However, the clicking noise will make your average indoor video unusable.

Reviews.Title: Bad Auto Focus? Those that say that are on acid or are nearly blind
Reviews.Author: Joshua Fountain "Amazon shopping has become a...
Reviews.Content: The Camera auto focuses very sharply and quickly. If those who were smart would update their firmware, then maybe they'd agree with me. I have a video that [...]the auto focus so you're welcome to see for yourself.[...]I love it, the touch screen is very responsive.Also what I notice that people do with the zooming is they don't press the W or T. That zooms it smoothly. They try to push up and down with their finger to zoom and it gives it a choppy zoom.The lens seems to have a very good quality aspect to it.I only wrote this review for the auto focus just to let you know that it focuses in quickly.Either do further research on youtube so you can see how it performs or don't buy it at all.

Reviews.Title: Not as expected
Reviews.Content: In order to get better quality you need to use this bloggy under full sun.Used in house is totally different.

Reviews.Title: Great price and video quality, but...
Reviews.Author: Joseph McCleary
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are very happy with our Bloggie, but the lack of flash makes it unusable as a camera in certain lights.  The video quality is awesome but again a light either built in or as an addon would be AMAZING.  Overall I recommend it for the quality of the design, software, ease of use and video quality (in good light).

Reviews.Title: Neat little device ... but only if you can live with its flaws
Reviews.Author: Ammy_Evaluator
Reviews.Content: What's to love?- The ergonomics are excellent... if you can live with the fact that it is surprisingly easy to cover the mic inputs while holding the camera, resulting in muffled sound.- The video quality is awesome @ 1080/30P and 720/60P... if you can live with the fact that it hunts for focus with the slightest shift in the camera and there's no way to help it along.... and it is not the most sensitive camera in low light. It does about as well as a Droid X.- The photo quality is pretty nice @ 12 MP 4:3, or 8MP 16:9... if you can live with no flash, which is a problem with both bright backlight (fill flash) and low light conditions.... and the focus issues are just as apparent in still mode as they are in video mode.- The user interface is really intuitive... except that there's not much control you can exert on this device.Would I recommend it to friends and family?The answer depends on how much you value the quality of your images and video. If the quality of video/stills is not critical, you could definitely do worse.However, if you're a stickler for image quality, then I'd strongly urge you to consider the Canon Powershot S95 - which is the best combination of still and video that I've encountered. While it's definitely not as cheap, the real question is how much are the memories you are capturing worth?Happy Filming!

Reviews.Title: Better Options For The Money
Reviews.Author: E. A. Montgomery
Reviews.Content: Pros -Small, about the size of a cell phoneFeels durable, nice casing, good screenIntuitive to useCons -Buggy touch screen, frustratingUseless in low lightFocus lags, poor focus for action shots, even low speed like bowlingI was very interested in the Sony Bloggie despite the lack of support for Apple users. (I understand that is coming soon). I was hoping for a phone sized camera that I could tuck in my bag for the kids to use at the skate park or to use myself at concerts or outdoor events. (We all take video/photos frequently) I was not intending to have this replace my camera, just to be something small and useful for impulse use. Unfortunately, nine out of ten things taken with the Bloggie were useless. When the conditions and lighting are perfect, the camera takes a lovely image - unfortunately my life rarely lends itself to perfect conditions. The bowling alley didn't have enough lighting for the camera to work properly for still or video. Shots taken outdoors were much better, but the focus lag still left several of them very blurry. I found the touch screen less responsive and accurate than on my other devices. This is a great idea, but it's just not well executed.Edited to add - Updating this 3/2012. The Bloggie has started overheating and shutting itself down in certain situations. In addition, I have had multiple occasions where it unexpectedly cleared the memory.

Reviews.Title: Basic, terrible in low light, poor focus, unreliable
Reviews.Author: J. Bateman "upstate dsp"
Reviews.Content: Received as a Christmas present and was initially excited by its HD capabilities in a small package. Unfortunately its flaws soon become apparent.As others have noted, it's very slow at focusing, sometimes fails to focus at all, and has no way to lock focus. A fatal flaw if you're trying to capture moving objects. The built in "demo" mode shows some action sequences; frankly I have a hard time believing they were actually captured on this model, since mine would have spent much of the time trying to focus on such scenes.Indoor shots, even under fairly reasonable lighting, are hopeless for both stills and video. Grainy and with a color balance that's WAY too red. And as it's all automated with no way for users to control the color balance, there's no way to work around that.The "zoom" is only digital, so you lose quality as soon as you zoom in.The kicker - on a recent trip, it somehow reset itself, erasing all the video & pictures recorded and reverting to Japanese menus. Wiping its memory is apparently a problem with this device (Google it). Clearly wholly unacceptable so it's going to be returned ASAP.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera of all time
Reviews.Author: Chris Andersen
Reviews.Content: Everything is grainy no matter the settings.  Must be defective as sony could never release something so horrible.  However just found more reviews with people experiencing the same issue.  Got duped, waste of money. Assumed Sony would not create something this horrible so now I'm stuck with shipping costs.  How did this camera win a pc magazine award?  Will not be buying anything through Amazon vendors again as getting stuck with shipping costs on a defective or intentionally hyped/junk product is bad business.

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera!
Reviews.Author: James Tuttle
Reviews.Content: I bought this expecting it to be equal to or better than the previous FLIP. Wow what a disappointment! The software does not allow you to pull pictures off of video, so be aware of that

Reviews.Title: Don't Bother
Reviews.Author: Searcaigh
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled with this little camera....but not anymore.  Twice the battery has shown fully charged and then died with the camera not even turning on.  The first time it recharged.  Now nothing--plugged into the computer and it will not charge.  It's going back.  Also, the Bloggie software quit on me more than once.  But that I could have lived with--the unreliable battery is a dealbreaker.Too bad.  I was really excited about this one.

Reviews.Title: not bad but a digital camera is the same price with better quality
Reviews.Author: panamaniac
Reviews.Content: the pictures are a little blurry and the video has no image stabilization. def needs a flash. also the video changes focus too easily on objects that move into frame when recording something far away. not bad but a digital camera with 720p and much better photo quality can be had for the same price. i returned it after a week.

Reviews.Title: Sony Corporation
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Product was defective out of the box. I could not download the software to my computer. After going through 3 levels of tech support it was determined that the software had not been installed on the camcorder and to send it to the Sony repair center for replacement. That was on the 13th of Dec. To this date Jan 4 I still have not received it. I have spoken to the repair center several times getting the same response. They are still working on it and it should be completed in the next few days. Has not happened. I will not be buying a Sony product anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie
Reviews.Author: Ronald L Flaherty
Reviews.Content: Well worth the money.  The entire transaction went well.  This product is not MAC compatible but soon will be.  Does not provide instruction to download videos.  Have to contact Sony directly to get the instructions.  I wish it was a bit more user friendly.  I would buy again.  The price was right and purchasing the HDMI cable through Amazon saves you a lot of money.  It only cost 1.50 vice paying 35 - 70 dollars at other stores.

Reviews.Title: How does it do in a gym for volleyball?
Reviews.Author: Kimberly A. Wiswell
Reviews.Content: People seem to define "low light" as that point where quality really drops. Inside a gym during the day is, to me, semi-low light. How doe the MHS-TS10 do for basketball or volleyball?

Reviews.Title: Don't buy
Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very good picture quality with good lighting. Small and light. It will charge and record at the same time.Cons: Focus goes out and takes a long time to recover. Annoying clicking in audio playback that seems to get worse every time I use it. I have to hold it horizontally (like a camera) for it to shoot in widescreen, if I don't I get black bars on both sides with a weird aspect ratio. Tri-pod mount is on the bottom for vertical shooting. Low light situations are almost unwatchable.If the focus worked correctly, and I could not hear the clicking, I would rate this a 4 star. I tried to like this, but it is getting returned. Do yourself a favor and wait for the next version of this, or look for a different pocket cam.

Reviews.Title: awkward to hold...
Reviews.Author: jpendergraft
Reviews.Content: Ok, it's high time I start contributing a bit...especially since I rely on these reviews so much.I picked this up today at Best Buy for $99.  It was intended as a gift for my daughter.  She's just in middle school and isn't a super "technical" type so a clean, not overly complex user interface was/is a motivating factor.  This piece is a very pretty package, too.  But that's about all the praise I can give.Once I turned it on, I noticed that the capacitive touch screen isn't as responsive as what most of us have grown accustomed to.  I had to tap on the various options usually more than once.  I got a little better at this with some practice, but the fact that I had to practice my "touch technique" at all is a fail in my opinion.  The next thing I noticed though was the real deal breaker.  It's very awkward to hold in operation.  It feels more natural and comfortable to hold it in a vertical orientation.  And just like the specs say, it will rotate the screen to keep everything right-side-up.  But that looks very strange in playback because it's creates huge black side bars, similar to watching a 4:3 image on a 2.35 screen except much worse.  So you ideally need to hold it horizontally, in which it's hard to find a comfortable grip.  For me at least, the grips that did work felt somewhat insecure, too.....instantly conjuring images of it getting dropped by my daughter.The actual video quality I'm not qualified to judge as I haven't had a camcorder since an old over the shoulder vhs, lol.  But I was satisfied with the video image quality.  I wasn't expecting anything spectacular given the optics on these tiny things, but I think it held it's own.  Stills weren't very good at all though.  My Nexus One takes just as good or better stills.Already boxed up for return....

Reviews.Title: The good, the bad and the ugly
Reviews.Author: txshopper
Reviews.Content: The Pros:Slim, ultra modern, looks like a piece of art.Fits in your pocket.Stunningly beautiful HD video.Ability to snap a pic while simultaneously recording a video (easier than it sounds).Built in USB connector that also charges internal battery.8gb of space to hold a bunch of videos and pics.The Cons:No flash. Your gonna miss some great club shots (they will have a red tone in low lighting.The HDMI port uses a mini HDMI cable not the standard size (absolutely unacceptable for the american market).You can only record up to 30 mins per video.The touchscreen is sometimes unresponsive and pressure needs to be applied when zooming.Zooming yields a audible clicking noise.The HD playback on a newer computer is choppy and out of sync unless you play it on the camera then it's fine.The navigation menu is not user friendly and can be confusing. I mean why would you have a play button take you to the photos??For the next generation bloggie they need to add a flash, wifi, revamp the menu and add a standard size hdmi cable outlet.

Reviews.Title: NOT HAPPY
Reviews.Author: Carol Borona
Reviews.Content: This product was used, not new. Unknown to us until we had DVDs made from our med cruise, It had Bloggie on it from previous owner, if I had my choice I need a NEW REPLACEMENT and then I will return this previously used BloggieCarol Borona1 Windsor RoadShelton, CT 06484

Reviews.Title: not for me
Reviews.Author: Beth
Reviews.Content: i do not like the bloggie touch bcz whenever you stop recording and then resume, it creates an entirely new video clip. it is not possible to link the seperate sections to create a  video of an event. the entire reason i purchased this camera was to record my nieces graduation on something i thought would be better (and unlike) my iphone . the explaination did not indicate this, made it seem as if yo would be able to create a video. however it was not true. in my opinion this camera is not worth the expense unless you do not have a smart phone with a camera.  also, bcz i purchased the camera from a seller other than amazon (bestbuy11) and the graduation was more than 30 days from purchase date, i could not return it.  so now i'm stuck with it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: wouldn't buy again
Reviews.Author: David Fleischer
Reviews.Content: This small, attractive flipcam yields a barely adequate result; the balky zoom is particularly disappointing, with the image going sadly in and out of focus.  Better products are available for the same price and I hope to upgrade soon.  There is no reason to buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Okay for price
Reviews.Author: Caroline
Reviews.Content: I bought the Sony bloggie touch camera a couple of days ago. I was impressed at first but then when you watch the video you have taken you realize that it does not pick of sound very well (only if close up) and the quality of the video is okay. But not good in low light.  I was really disapointed in it so i am taking it back to get a different product. I would not recoment this product:(

Reviews.Title: Short on software, and features.
Reviews.Author: earthloc
Reviews.Content: The ease of use of the camera is great. Pictures and also great.  Even my wife can use it.The play back does not offer slide show capabilities.  You have to start each clip manually.  Not good.  With my previous Sony camera you could start a clip and it would continuously play on a TV until all are played or stopped.  If you have 15 to 20 clips you have to stay within cable reach and use your finger to move to the next clip and tap it to get it to play.  In my opinion, that sucks.At this point I would say the software is very short on capabilities.  You can't combine clips.  I've yet to find out how to put the videos on a DVD.  There is no help screen.  There is a need for instruction.  If you have no or very little experience with the software you are totally lost.  Which is where I am.I would not buy it again, if fact I am considering returning it.

Reviews.Title: Chatter issue
Reviews.Author: Shirleen Turko
Reviews.Content: I returned both my initial purchase and the replacement unit as both had the same audio issue.  Upon playback the audio would fade and a chatter noise could be heard.  It was very disappointing, as the Bloggie Touch seemed like the perfect HD camcorder/camera.

Reviews.Title: Sony Bloggie Touch
Reviews.Author: Marc Schuyler "Marc"
Reviews.Content: This product will apparently not work with Vista, i.e., I get an error that reads "cannot connect to localhost: 2468 index"; Sony support was not helpful, a waste of time, and worse than useless.  Judging from other posts about this problem, Sony simply designed this product, didn't bother to determine reliability, and then just cast the product to the wolves.  I am returning my product to Costco and will get a Flip instead (i.e., something that actually works when I try to install it).  I should bill Sony for wasting my time....

Reviews.Title: Bought one, wish I hadn't.
Reviews.Author: Elaine Booker
Reviews.Content: I bought a Bloggie to replace my original Flip video camera, which I use to film student training sessions.  Wish I hadn't bought the Bloggie.  While I have other video cameras and digital cameras that are more sophisticated, I needed something I could easily hand off to someone to video while I provide instruction to the student - a camera that is a basic point and shoot with one start/stop button is all that I wanted.  I don't have the time to explain the camera's use to someone else.  Will give the Bloggie to someone else and look for another Flip.

Reviews.Title: The worst camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: Heather Frazier
Reviews.Content: PROS:Picture and video quality are great outdoors on nice, sunny days.CONS:Has problems focusing...focus is PAINFULLY slow and sometimes true focus is not achieved.No flash!Indoor video and photos are quite awful.Very easy to delete photos accidentally.I didn't really like the bloggie software or how it organizes photos/videos.Awkward to hold and use. Touch screen zoom is not very functional.

Reviews.Title: difficult to review/. Updated Review
Reviews.Author: gene
Reviews.Content: I received this item quickly and on schedule which was good.  But it hasn't worked since I got it.  It had only a minute's battery life on it when it arrived and I was unable to get it to take a charge.  I tried it a number of times using the cord supplied but it wouldn't work.  I contacted Amazon and they suggested a return, but then I contacted Sony and they said to send it in for repair under warranty and that's what I did.  They were very fast and it was out and back in just over a week.  They replaced the battery and initially it seemed to work.  However I only had maybe 15 minutes of recording time with it when the battery went down again.  I hooked it up to charge but once again the camera wouldn't take a charge.  Contacted Sony again and had to ship it once more for repair.  I don't know what the problem is, but I hope it is corrected soon. The warranty dept has been very accomodating, but it would be nice if the camera worked properly at some point.  When I did use it briefly it was good. Fits easily in your pocket.  Has good video and sound and image stabilization is good.  It's a tiny, pocket video and accept it for that.  If you want more, buy a different camera.  Very similar here, to an I Phone video, but if you don't have that, it's great. I just wish they could get this battery problem fixed in the one I have.Here is an updated review:  After the initial charging problem and mailing it back to Sony under warranty, with no shipping charges to me, it now works great.  Apparently they replaced the entire inner unit due to some technical problem.  They were fast with the turnaround time and made all efforts to get it right.  I like it, and have had no further problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Bloggie
Reviews.Author: Oversig
Reviews.Content: I got the MHS-TS20/B for Christmas & in less than 10min, of using it it had a real bad pixel & sound distortion problem.Also like others have mentioned the inability to focus is a real problem with also no-way of adjusting the lighting like with all other cameras/camcorders....Needless to say I returned it!I'll keep my Sony cyber-shot & camcorder. But the Bloggie in my opinion is not up to Sony standards.((Pure Junk))

Reviews.Title: Good small video recorder by terrible camera.
Reviews.Author: Patrick Holt "txdragon"
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feeling on this product.  On one hand, if you need something conveient to carry in your pocket for recording video, this thing does a pretty good job of it. Although it does suffer from some white balance issues in mixed lighting.  The touch screen is fairly intuitive, but the layout of the menus is somewhat kludgy. Its easy to accidently reset the device to defaults.  I was a little disappoint by the cable that came with the device.  It would be sufficient to connect it to your laptop, however, the device literally has to hang off my desktop from the usb port.The camera portion of the device is very poor.  First off, the default setting for the camera is low res.  2nd off, once you set the camera to take pictures at full resolution, the focus if very slow, and it it does not handle low light very well at all.  Photos in anything but bright light tended to be very blurry, suggesting a fairly slow shutter speed.  So as a camera, I would say this is less usefull than the camera you probably have on your phone.Long story short, if you looking just for a hand pocket recorder to record video of an event, or bday party,record a college lecture, or yes even your own blog this little device fits in your pocket, takes decent video,and doesn't have a hard learning curve.  However video is about the only thing its good for.

Reviews.Title: does not work
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: I cannot emphasize the importance of an electronic device working on the first try. I have wasted over 30 minutes trying to get this stupid camera to connect to my computer, which is running windows 7 with more than the requirements of the bloggie. Sony has let me down again with no support on their website. I downloaded the software there and it still DOES NOT CONNECT. Simply runs a loop of turning on and off, like this is somehow helpful. DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!

Reviews.Title: Don't bother...
Reviews.Author: con-sumer
Reviews.Content: If you're serious abotu vlogging or videoing anything, or if you're not serious, still don't get it. The pictures are grainy and the video is the same. The stabilization looks terrible and will surely make your viewers hate you. If you have an iPhone you'd be better off sticking with that... the iPhone's shaky video at least makes you want to vomit less.

Reviews.Title: Just use your smart phone camera/ software is ridiculous
Reviews.Author: hisnameisgeorgeglass
Reviews.Content: I bought this on a whim because I needed a recording device to record lectures for class.  Right from the get go, I wasn't a fan.  The camera is not all that great, honestly, my sister's smart phone takes just as good of videos as the bloggie does.  That being said, I could live with it.  EXCEPT for the bloggie software.  It's TERRIBLE.  Has anyone here tried using it?  Really poorly designed software.  So when you actually do use your bloggie and want to get the photos/videos off of it, it's such a headache!The software is ridiculously counterproductive, I haven't the time to rant anymore about the details of that, but can I get an amen?  Anyone?K I'm done.  To potential buyers, seriously, just use get a smart phone.

Reviews.Title: bloggie
Reviews.Author: Bridget Zamot
Reviews.Content: The still picture quality of this camera is extremely poor no flash and very little zoom ability very disappointing purchase

Reviews.Title: It doesn't record after 29 minutes!!
Reviews.Author: She
Reviews.Content: It advertises that it can record up to 4 hours... and more. And guess what! The recording stops at around 29 minutes even if you have space. What a shame! I bought this for recording recitals but.. it stops every time and I checked the manual today and it says.. it can make only up to 29 minutes of video files.. I am very very disappointed..

Reviews.Title: Bloggie camera
Reviews.Author: P. Mendelberg
Reviews.Content: I went back and forth between spending more for a better camera or getting this one.  There were already some reviews suggesting problems with focusing or a noise when doing this. I took a chance on this one as the price seemed right and perhaps the reviewers were being too critical as the reviews were mixed. I took it to a graduation in a midsize auditorium. I was sitting near the back. I found it impossibe to get it to focus properly on the stage. Perhaps it was the lighting but no matter, the picture was poor. Moving up into the isle did not help. Ultimately, I found that the delay in getting any focus unless relatively close up is very long resulting in poor picture quality. As a result I doubt that this video camera will be much use to me. Now I consider it almost a waste of money but I will keep trying to use it. The still camera part works a little better between 3 to 15 feet.

Reviews.Title: Dashed hopes
Reviews.Author: Chrish
Reviews.Content: I bought this because my Flip "died" and no more customer support. I was excited to get it, reading the reviews, but I have to say that I miss my Flip a lot. I tried filming some theatre scenes and they are so grainy and fuzzy, they are useless. This never happened with the Flip.And as for sharing, I have created an account, but it keeps telling me that I do not have an account, so in spite of having taken about 2 hours of film, I am not able to share it. The help section is pretty pathetic, so I went  online to see what I could find.  So far, nothing. Rather disappointed, as I need this for my work.

Reviews.Title: Sounds like it would be good but NOT
Reviews.Author: T
Reviews.Content: UN USER FRIENDLY......the manual is hard to figure out how to simply download the user manual which, is a 73 page color document.... it doesn't even provide instructions to copy to DVD etc.I'm returning mine along with 2 SONY camera cases. SONY told me they would send a pre paid return label to me along with the cases, I knew that at least one of them would be going back. There was no pre paid return label in the package, A total LIE, Any return requires return merchandise authorization which takes at least half an hour, and a lot of aggravation. Any return must be returned in the original box, which was a huge box for two small camera cases, which will require a trip to the post office, and probably $10 for shipping. I will be avoiding Sony products indefinitely.TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Reviews.Title: dont rely on pics to be there when u get home
Reviews.Author: gus
Reviews.Content: vidoed and took pics of my child's christmas program.  stepped back to let another parent take a pics and some how in the process the internal memory deleted all the videos and pics!! gone tried to get help w recovering the images and bloggie doesnt have software to get deleted videos/pics back (per sony media and online tech support (30 min of chatting to be refered to another website)) had to call sony media and was told for a small 60$$ fee and 2 week delay they could try and get the pics but no promises.not the first time this is happened but will be the last will see this p.o.s. on craigs list for sale soon!!!

Reviews.Title: Not what I thought it would be.
Reviews.Author: MrsLizzzie
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this camera.  But now wishes I would have spent my money on something else.  It is a huge dissapointment.  Sony can do a lot to make this a better camera.  Right now its an unfinished product.  Ive had this camera since it came out and wished I would have waited.PROS-small and lite-the video turns on super fast and i love that you can take pictures while filming. (you get better pictures this way)CONS-NO FLASH!!!!!!!!!!!!-there is lag when you take a picture-the flip out is very supidly placed.  if you slip it into ur pocket and then bend over it pops out.  if you were to bend the wrong way it would snap off.  then there would be no way to get the pictures off so then it would be a nice $200 paper weight.All in all Im buying a new camera and am stuck with this one.  Waste of money.  Dont get it.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS
Reviews.Author: Afterwork Student
Reviews.Content: BEFORE YOU DECIDE TO BUY, Just go online and look for articles, comments and YouTube videos about a horrible clicking sound in the Bloggie Touch that ruins your videos. It is not audible until you playback the videos you created on a computer or TV. Sony refuses to acknowledge the problem. This is widespread and if you purchase this product you will be sorry.

Reviews.Title: STOP THE CLICKING!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey J. Deleeuw
Reviews.Content: The clicking problem continues on our Bloggie no matter how many times we have sent it in to be repaired(3 times now!).I've had it.I've spent hours dealing with Sony who refuses to even ACKNOWLEDGE ANY clicking problem at all(Goggle it, Sony).I have had to demand an accurate Statement Of Work from the Laredo repair service because Sony only lists the PARTS they used to "repair" the Bloggie,which is NOT a Statement Of Work, but a Statement Of Parts. More proof that Sony does NOT wish to admit to this issue. I finally received an e-mail which somewhat acknowledges the clicking problem. I am currently waiting for the Sony rep to get back to me because I have demanded a NEW Bloggie. If I am not satisfied, I will be spreading that e-mail acknowledging the clicking issue far and wide, including every one of their CEO's and Board members, of which I have found a detailed listing of contact information(which wasn't easy, mind you!).DO NOT BUY THIS ITEM!!!!!!!!SONY WILL NOT STAND BEHIND IT!!!!!!!Update: Sony is shipping us a new Bloggie--different model, 22L? It's the relatively new sports version. I'll get back with another update if the clicking affects this model as well.

Reviews.Title: dismal product
Reviews.Author: Ananda
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Sony Bloggy camera but the first time I used it I saw that it is entirely insufficient for my needs. I tried to film indoors, with all the lights turned up high, but there was not enough light for the camera.The next day I took the camera to a pawn shop and got 35 dollars for it.what a waste!

Reviews.Title: Increasingly Dissatisfied
Reviews.Author: Allison Lloyd
Reviews.Content: I got a Sony Bloggie for Christmas last year, and it's taken 4 months for me to realize all of its shortcomings.First, there is no flash. No flash on a camera in 2011?! Indoor pictures, even when flooded with window and overhead light, turn out dark. Disappointing.Second, unless pictures are taken with a tripod, they often turn out blurry and slightly out of focus. Also, no modes for "landscape" "portrait" etc. exist.Third, the software is a mess. All photos land in an "Everything" folder in thumbnail form, making a large portion of pictures very difficult to sort through. After installing an update, many pictures went completely black, and after a call to a Sony technician, they just told me to re-install the software (which made no difference). Grrr.I waited past the 90 days to return this to the manufacturer where it was purchased. After calling Sony with all these complaints, they said they were unable to do anything for me either. I wish I would have stuck with a Flip camera and a separate still camera. Don't make the same mistake I did...

Reviews.Title: Not good at all
Reviews.Author: Michael T.
Reviews.Content: I really do not like this product. It's my first Sony product I got for Christmas and I won't be getting another. There is NO FLASH! I know that may seem silly to worry about but you can't take any stills at night. Video-wise, it's pretty good sometimes, but most of the times it is focusing the WHOLE TIME! The Auto-focus is awful, and sometimes when I zoom in it won't focus again at all. Also, the microphone is right where you automatically put your hand while holding the camera. Not a fan.

Reviews.Title: Shuts off automatically after 30 mins of recording
Reviews.Author: Anony
Reviews.Content: Buyers beware: this video camera shuts off automatically after 30 mins (actually I read a post that says its 29).  I bought this to make professional teaching DVDS and it has cost me lots of extra hours re-creating videos that were cut off in mid sentence.  I'm sure there are better cameras out there for the price.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money!
Reviews.Author: Penni
Reviews.Content: Who ever heard of a camera without a flash....what a waste of money! I think the touch screen feature is amazing. But that's about it

Reviews.Title: STAY AWAY FROM 6 AVE ELECTRONIC !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: JAN JEZEK
Reviews.Content: SIX AVE ELECTRONIC is the worst store to buy from.They ignore all my emails (4).NEVER SHIP MY ITEM.STAY AWAY FROM THEM!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Who writes your reviews?  Sony?
Reviews.Author: chelch
Reviews.Content: I can't believe all the exaggerated glorifying reviews of this camera.  I think people are now paid (by Sony? in this case)  to write extensive positive reviews of items.  You can't trust any of these reviews anymore!  It's like reading an ad for the product.  Just sayin'

Reviews.Title: Bloggie? Is Sony kidding?
Reviews.Author: Rodney John Hill
Reviews.Content: Can't offer a review, I really want to buy a Sony video camera, but if people see me carrying around something called a "Bloggie" I might get beaten up!
